description:
Full Job Description
Company Summary:
Zoro.com is an eCommerce company that sells business supplies, equipment, and tools—but we’re much more than just a website. We’re a team of people who win and lose together (we prefer winning!). Since 2011, Zoro has been working hard to make it easy for our customers to purchase everything they need to make their businesses go. Zoro currently offers 3 million products, fast and free shipping, no-hassle returns, and exceptional customer service. We’ve grown quickly in a short time, recently surpassing 400 team members and reaching annual revenue of over $500 million. Add to that our award-winning culture—we were named a Great Place to Work for 2019-20, among other accolades—and we think Zoro is a pretty amazing place to work and grow.

Description:
Are you ready to take on the technical challenges of a very successful and fast-growing eCommerce company backed by an industry leader? At Zoro, we are transforming from a scrappy startup into an eCommerce juggernaut, and we are already wildly successful. That means there are plenty of opportunities to get hands-on with transformative work that others only dream of. Work that will set you up for success and put you ahead of your peers on LinkedIn.

Primary Function:
Zoro is looking for an intern to help with software design, coding, and debugging. Asa member of our core engineering team, you will work alongside our expert engineers to implement far-reaching, customer-facing solutions. You will work on exciting and challenging software engineering problems that will shape the future ofeCommerce as we know it. Are you up for that?

For example:
You will actively participate in a fully implemented scalable agile development framework
You will develop features and functions for eCommerce initiatives
You will assist with ETL and data feed management
You will share in ERP integration development

Duties and Responsibilities:
Document and test new software applications
Assess new application ideas
Research competitor offerings
Develop applications

Qualifications:
Experience gained in the classroom and through personal projects will be considered.
Applicants should have excellent analytical skills, with the ability to work in teams
You are working towards a degree in Computer Science or a related field
Experience with Python or JavaScript preferred
Shell scripting experience is a plus
Experience with Vagrant and Docker a plus
Majors: Computer Science, Software/Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics

Final note:
We share a commitment to our Zoro values – Win & Lose Together (We prefer winning!), Take Ownership, We Are Transparent, and Aspire to be Customer-Obsessed. Everything we do at Zoro is centered around delighting our customers. It's a natural extension of our company culture and how we care for each other. We believe when we act in ways that are consistent with these values, we can solve any technical challenge that lies ahead of us. As a Zoro employee, you can expect to work with smart, energetic people, learn something every day, and be valued for your perspective.

Zoro is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Full Job Description

IT Technician Intern
Job Title IT Technician, Intern

Location: North Logan, UT

LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY PLEASE

Status: Part-Time, Internship

Wage: $12.00 - $14.00, DOE

Electric Power Systems (EPS) is an innovative Technology company that supplies Energy Storage Systems to Aerospace & Transportation applications. Our team develops innovative cutting-edge system solutions to address major societal issues by providing sustainable electric propulsion systems. EPS is seeking talent that is drawn to solving new problems, comfortable with thinking out of the box, has a proven history of successful innovation, and enjoys working on a team with like-minded individuals. EPS is building its Electric Propulsion capabilities in Logan Utah and is looking for like-minded individuals to staff its new North Logan, UT, facility.

IT Technician responsibilities

Maintain efficient and optimal internal workflow by resolving technical concerns and difficulties promptly and completely. This requires broad technical knowledge with strong problem-solving capabilities. It also requires the ability to effectively communicate needs and solutions to various departments and groups. Other specific job duties include:

IT Technician skills

 Diagnose and remedy various hardware and software malfunctions.

 Monitor company assets and equipment and ensure compliance to internal standards of traceability, performance, and security.

 Facilitate communication between Engineering Department and IT Department regarding upkeep and organization of file structure system.

 Organize and consolidate company software subscriptions.

 Deploy mobile device management on new and existing company devices.

 Maintain a clean and organized server room.

 Support training of employees on new systems and technology.

 Research and analyze new hardware and software capabilities to integrate into the larger business technology framework.

 Assist IT in any other required duties.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

 Pursuing a technical, associate’s or bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems,

Business Administration, or another related field.

 Relevant experience in IT infrastructure, troubleshooting hardware/software malfunctions.

 Broad knowledge in application software, technologies, and networking systems.

 Ability to quickly absorb information and become a subject matter expert.

 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

 Strong problem-solving abilities and ability to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions.

 Proven ability to work well independently or on a team.

 U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident Alien status is required.

position: Intern - Identity and Access Management Security Engineer
description:
Full Job Description
Location: 20 E. Thomas Road, Phoenix, AZ 85012
Timeline: 10 Weeks, beginning June 7, 2021

We are looking for an Identity and Access Management (IAM) Security Engineering Intern to join the Identity, Access, and Automation team within our Information Security Department. You will participate in a paid program designed to provide you with real-world experience and prepare you for an exciting role in a corporate environment. This internship will help you acquire marketable skills by providing an opportunity to apply your academic knowledge to real-world scenarios.

The successful candidate will be a highly analytical, passionate, and self-driven individual who loves to learn, solve problems, and contribute to the advancement of the team.

Internship Responsibilities:
Gain an understanding of and contribute to the design and implementation of IAM functions, including:
User and system account provisioning
Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
Auditing and recertification of system access
Privileged Access Management (PAM)
Perform other security-related duties as requested

In order to be a successful intern, you will need to possess the following background/experience:
Scripting and/or programming skills in at least one language/technology, such as C, PowerShell, SQL, Python, or JSON
Fundamental knowledge of authentication and access control methods
Fundamental knowledge of API-driven systems integration and automation concepts
Fundamental knowledge of networking - OSI model
Strong analytical skillset and attention to detail
Ability to research, analyze, and resolve problems
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Highly motivated individual with the ability to self-start, prioritize, and multi-task

Targeted Majors: Computer Science, Cyber Security or related field

Minimum Requirements:
Current students with at least 80 hours of completed course work towards Bachelor’s degree
Demonstrated academic success (minimum 3.5 GPA)

Preferred Requirement:
Desire and ability to quickly learn and implement new technologies
Ability to work in Windows (GUI-based) and command line systems, such as Linux Be A Part Of The Team Behind Our Success!

Skitter TV/EPIC Video Technologies, Inc (http://epicvideo.tech) is currently seeking a self-starting, energetic, collaborative, Software Engineering Intern, a current, recent college student, or recent Bootcamp graduate, with demonstrable experience developing React/React Native or PHP applications.

About the role:

This is a part-time or full-time position in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment. The Software Engineering Intern will join either the Front End Development team, currently building AndroidTV and Mobile applications, or the Back End Development team building containerized cloud-based Microservices and REST APIs for Skitter TV’s next-generation end-to-end IPTV solution. This is your opportunity to join a team where you will be able to make immediate and valuable contributions as a member of the software engineering team.

Job Summary: Skitter TV is seeking energetic, talented, college or recently graduated students with a degree in engineering, computer science, math, or science. This is an internship that has the potential to become a full-time position. The Software Engineering Intern will assist the Software Engineering, Operations, Customer Support, and Network Engineering teams to build, deploy, and maintain Skitter TV’s innovative, industry-leading IPTV products and services. This is your opportunity to join a team where you will be plugged in immediately to help design, build, and maintain enterprise applications, innovative products, and large-scale operational systems. You will be writing code and building applications from day 1.

  • Experience with SQL, REST, HTML, MongoDB, MySQL, SQLite, Linux, Docker
  • Experience with Jira, Bitbucket

Full Job Description

Full Stack JavaScript Developer - Intern

Preferred Applicant:

  • Expertise in React.js, Node.js, JavaScript, TypeScript/React Native
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or working towards one).
  • Passion for photography and travel
  • Demonstrates high academic achievement and leadership skills
  • Organized and well written/spoken.
  • US Citizen
  • Familiarity with social media

About us:

We are a fast-growing tech start-up creating a photocentric, niche travel progressive web application that covers many of the top attractions in the US and Canada.

Mission:

We strive to challenge the creativity and pique the interest of photography minded individuals and those who love the timeless beauty of natural and urban landscapes.

Job Description:

We are looking for a great JavaScript developer who is proficient with React.js, Node.js, JavaScript, TypeScript/React Native. You will develop front-end and back-end components. You will ensure that these components and the overall application are robust and easy to maintain. You will coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure.

Job Responsibilities:

We are seeking an Software Developer to:

  • Develop new features using a combination of JavaScript and TypeScript.
  • Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use
  • Translating designs and wire-frames into high quality code
  • Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers
  • Design and implement low-latency, high-availability, performant back-end applications using Node.js.
  • Security and data protection
  • Integration of data storage solutions like MySQL, etc.
  • Setup API integrations with various 3rd parties that enable and optimize business processes
  • Provide test coverage including unit and automated tests
  • Present innovative ideas in which to improve existing systems, processes, or services, including new perspectives based on independent research of the industry.
  • Become an expert on the details and direction of the project to ensure successful implementation of the CEO’s vision.
  • Attend weekly team meetings to contribute strategic and creative solutions unique to start-up companies.
  • Diagnose, report, and brainstorm resolutions to issues as they arise.
  • Hold yourself accountable for submitting work without frequent direction or check-ins.
  • Develop good working relationships with clients, strategic partners and internal teams: be comfortable interacting with and explaining concepts to internal and external audiences
  • Quickly adapt in a fast-paced dynamic business environment

Required Experience:

  • Interest in landscape and nature photography. Interest in travel.
  • Demonstrated proficiency with JavaScript and TypeScript.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills. Like most companies, we will communicate using Slack, Confluence, Jira and Google Drive.
  • Independent time management to ensure completion of tasks according schedule

What You’ll Learn:

  • Hands-on experience with web development in the start-up world
  • Exposure to financial and technical challenges faced in entrepreneurship and the creative solutions required to solve them
  • Ins and outs of the travel industry, including photography, design, customer relations, social media influence, marketing, and web development/maintenance.

Pay:

$10 per hour, w/ potential for a raise depending on quality and commitment to your work.

Full Job Description
Glendale Community College

Salary:
Job Number: 673214-21

Location: Glendale, CA

Department: All Depts

Closing: 3/31/2021 11:59 PM Pacific

Description

The Faculty Diversity Internship Program trains and prepares interns, interested in teaching at a community college, for future faculty employment opportunities. The intent of the program is to increase the pool of potential candidates that reflect the diversity of our student population in the local community, greater Los Angeles area, and internationally. The Faculty Intern will participate in professional development workshops on various instructional related topics and classroom training with a mentor in a specific discipline. ALL Program activities for 2021 will be virtual.

Applications will be accepted for all disciplines including, but not limited to, the following areas: Biology, Chemistry, Nursing, Computer Science, Economics, English, English as a Second Language (ESL), Marketing, Math, Music, Social Sciences, Sociology, Language Arts and Speech/Communications.

The program is not available for counseling interns.

Minimum Qualifications

The eligibility requirements are:
No community college teaching experience. Applicants with teaching experience in the following areas are eligible to apply:
Teacher's Assistant
K-12 teaching experience
Must be in good academic standing at an accredited college or university
General Education Disciplines
Within one year of completing a master's or doctoral degree program at an accredited institution
Career Technical Education (CTE)
Six years of related work experience and within one year of completing an Associate degree, or four years of related work experience and within one year of completing a Bachelor's degree at an accredited college
Degree Holders
Meet faculty minimum qualifications. Please refer to GCC Minimum Qualifications list.

Additional Information

How To Apply

The following documents must to be attached to the online application:

Professional Resume
Letter of Interest (2 page limit)
Unofficial copy's of all transcripts
Foreign transcripts and degrees require official certification of equivalency to U.S. transcripts and degrees by a certified U.S. review service at the time of application.

All required documentation must be attached to the online application, by the applicant, by the closing date. Additional documents not requested in the announcement, will not be reviewed. Applications with incomplete information (i.e. statements such as "see resume") or missing documents will not be considered.

The District does not sponsor Visas.

Applications must be submitted by Wednesday , March 31, 2021 at 11:59 p.m.

Selection Process:
All completed applications and required documents will be screened for completeness and the eligibility requirements stated in the job announcement. A select number of candidates will be invited for an interview. All candidates will be notified by email of their final disposition in the selection process. If you have any questions please call 818-240-1000 ext. 5921.

About the College
Glendale Community College (GCC) is nestled in the foothills of the San Rafael Mountains, centrally located at the intersection of three major freeways, just ten miles from downtown Los Angeles. Glendale is affectionately known as Jewel City, one of the fastest growing communities in the Southern California region. A vibrant hub of economic activity and cultural diversity; it is an exciting place to work and live!

GCC is recognized throughout the state as a model of shared governance and collegiality. Known for excellence and rigor, we have one of the highest transfer rates to the UC system and other California four-year colleges. Additionally, the college offers a broad range of vocational programs and takes pride in providing outstanding student services and curriculum to help prepare students for success in the 21st Century.

GCC is committed to maintaining an environment which provides opportunities to individuals with a wide variety of talents, experiences, perspectives, and backgrounds. We believe in the importance of diversity amongst our faculty, staff, and student population to better serve the college and surrounding communities

Equal Employment Opportunity
Glendale Community College District provides all applicants for district employment with equal employment opportunities and provides present employees with training, compensation, promotion, and all other attributes of employment without regard to a person's race, religious creed, color, age, sex, national origin, veterans' status, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, medical condition, gender identity or disability.

Accommodations
Applicants who require a reasonable accommodation for the application, testing or interviewing processes should contact the Human Resources Department at the time of application submission.

Thank you for your interest in employment opportunities with Glendale Community College.

CALIFORNIA COMMUNITY COLLEGES: THE WAY CALIFORNIA WORKS

To apply, please visit https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/gccedu/jobs/2959291/faculty-intern

Full Job Description

Systems Administrator Intern
We are looking for a System Administrator to maintain, upgrade and manage our software, hardware and networks. Resourcefulness is a necessary skill in this role. You should be able to diagnose and resolve problems quickly. You should have the patience to communicate with a variety of interdisciplinary teams and users. Your goal will be to ensure that our technology infrastructure runs smoothly and efficiently.

Responsibilities

  • Install and configure software and hardware
  • Manage network servers and technology tools
  • Set up accounts and workstations
  • Monitor performance and maintain systems according to requirements
  • Troubleshoot issues and outages
  • Ensure security through access controls, backups and firewalls
  • Upgrade systems with new releases and models
  • Develop expertise to train staff on new technologies
  • Build an internal wiki with technical documentation, manuals and IT policies

Skills

  • Proven experience as a System Administrator, Network Administrator or similar role
  • Experience with databases, networks (LAN, WAN) and patch management
  • Knowledge of system security (e.g. intrusion detection systems) and data backup/recovery
  • Ability to create scripts in Python, Perl or other language
  • Familiarity with various operating systems and platforms
  • Resourcefulness and problem-solving aptitude
  • Excellent communication skills
  • BSc/Ba in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related discipline; professional certification (e.g. Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA)) is a plus

position: DMED Technology Software Engineer Intern - Remote, Summer 2021
description:
Full Job Description
Job Summary:
Comprised of Disney’s international media businesses and the Company’s various streaming services,the Disney Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) segment aligns technology, media distribution, and advertising sales into a single business segment to create and deliver personalized entertainment experiences to consumers around the world. Playing an important role in the growth and future of DMED and The Walt Disney Company, the Technology team helps drive the strategic development and deployment of technology at the Walt Disney Company. It creates products, platforms and innovations for Disney’s portfolio of brands and businesses, while building scalable systems that connect hundreds of millions of consumers to Disney’s beloved stories, characters and brands.

The DMED Technology team is looking to fill 4 Software Engineering internships across various teams.
By applying to this posting, you will be considered for one or more of these opportunities. Specific interests and teams will be discussed during the interview phase.

Software Engineer Intern- Office of the CTO
Walt Disney Media and Entertainment Distribution Technology touches countless aspects of Disney’s content production and distribution, and in the Office of the CTO, you will be at the center of it all. This small but energetic team of creative problem solvers is responsive to the needs of the organization at large and builds prototypes and tools supporting technology division leadership.

This internship offers a unique blend of learning the operation and varied responsibilities of DMED Technology and assisting in the development of internal tools and prototypes. You will join longer-term projects in progress and help start new projects, while also working to complete a project from start to finish while gaining exposure to our software engineering, media engineering, and operational teams.

Software Engineer Intern- Platform Engineer, Distribution Platforms Team
The Platform Engineering team is responsible for the data delivery powering all of ESPN’s consumer facing digital products highlighted by the ESPN App, ESPN.com, Fantasy, and WatchESPN applications. With millions of fans creating billions of requests to platform services on a daily basis the team focuses heavily on quality, performance and scalability. As the key player in the distribution of data the team is also integral in the construction of digital products and is influential in their technical design. This is a great opportunity to see your work in the wild delivering top quality products consumed by millions.

Software Engineer Intern-Ad Platform Team
The DMED Ad Platform integrates with thousands of advertisers, with over a billion ads served per month. Before being served to a viewer, each one of these ads goes through a sophisticated workflow involving sales and planning, targeting, trafficking, and quality control, to deliver maximum value to our advertisers while maintaining an engaging experience for viewers. The Unified Ad Platform team is comprised of diverse and passionate programmers. Together we create and maintain the software systems to deliver ads to millions of Hulu and Disney subscribers.

The current focus of our team is to build our new microservice architecture, using Sprint Boot. We use many AWS managed services in our day-to-day work, including Kinesis, Dynamo, Redis, and SQS. We focus on clear and well written code, documentation, simple designs, performance, and scalability.

Software Engineer Intern- Observability Team
As a part of DMED Technology, our teams are responsible for developing the tools, platforms and methodologies that deliver performance, resilient, and efficient private and public cloud platforms and architectures supporting consumer facing applications and brands across Disney, ABC, ESPN, Pixar, Marvel, NatGeo and LucasFilm.

Responsibilities:
A Day in the Life...
Participate in daily standup, sprint planning, and overall work tracking
Working as a member of a larger team on larger projects in design and implementation
Creatively solving problems with self-direction; Some tasks may only have high level descriptions and you will find a solution
Learning about how we deliver Disney content to our fans around the world and applying this knowledge to your assigned projects
Proactively support and maintain production systems to prevent issues before they occur
Clearly communicate technical findings, issues, and outcomes with other team members
Participate in daily scrum meetings

Basic Qualifications:
What we are looking for…

Familiarity and experience with the following coding languages: Java, Javascript, Python, Ruby, and/or Bash
An understanding of Agile development practices
Experience with Web Application Development
Designing, implementing, and improving RESTful APIs
Able to understand what ‘the ask is’ and work towards a solution with minimal input
Team player – Enjoy working collaboratively with a talented group of people to tackle challenging business problems as a team
Eagerness to learn new technologies, and a strong desire to be challenged technically

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Node.JS
Experience with either relational or document-oriented databases
Experience deploying to cloud-based service providers
Strong passion for iOS, Android or Web client engineering
Experience working with Digital Advertising platforms is a huge plus

Required Education
Sophomore, Junior, or Senior level student or recent graduate pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems or related field.

Additional Information:
Internship Eligibility:
Must be enrolled in an accredited college/university taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program OR must have graduated from a college/university within 18 months OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Professional Internship
Must be at least 18 years of age
Must not have completed one year of continual employment on a Disney internship or program.
Must possess unrestricted work authorization
Must provide full work availability
Must provide own transportation to/from work (if it becomes in-person)
Current Active Disney cast members must meet Professional Internship transfer guidelines (for Walt Disney World cast members this is no more than four points and one reprimand in the last six months; for Disneyland cast members this is six months of consecutive service and a performance record clear of any disciplinary issues (warnings, suspensions, etc.) for at least six months)

Program Length: The approximate dates of this internship are 05/17/2021- 08/07/2021. Interns must be fully available for the duration of the internship.

Recommendation – Print or Save This Role Description: Strong candidates may be invited to complete a phone interview. We strongly encourage applicants to print a copy of this role description so they can refer to it in the event they are selected for a phone interview.

position: Product Management Intern: Intut Identity and Profile Platform Team
description:
Full Job Description
Overview

Intuit is a mission-driven, global financial platform company that gives everyone the opportunity to prosper. With products like TurboTax, QuickBooks and Mint, we’re using technology to build solutions to challenging financial problems for millions of people around the world.

The Intuit Identity & Profile Platform is a critical part of Intuit’s future success! Our team is responsible for enabling the Intuit identity ecosystem, a common platform for all Intuit product experiences and partners. Identity & Profile is at the center of enabling the Intuit’s “One Ecosystem” vision and Intuit’s mission of “Powering Prosperity around the World”. We are currently looking for a strategic, analytical, motivated, technology-oriented product management intern to work on making identity and authentication seamless and secure. You will work on technologies that will enable a magical password-less experience at Intuit.

In this role, you will put the needs of Intuit Customers first (consumers; small-businesses; self-employed; and pros), and will challenge the status quo. Our Identity Platform consists of both user facing native and web experiences and the underlying platform & services that enable creation and access to Intuit accounts.

You will manage our existing feature-set and KPIs while helping create & deliver the future strategy, roadmap, and features that will take our platform to a whole new level.

You are going to be instrumental in our quest to make the Intuit Identity experience second to none. The future of Identity at Intuit is exciting! Come be a part of it!

What you'll bring
Must be enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering or a related field
Knowledge of data analytics and statistics to size the business opportunity
Ability to juggle multiple priorities and thrive in fast-paced environments
Strong problem-solving abilities; you can cut through the noise and laser focus on what really matters
Familiarity with the Lean Startup Model (Build, Measure, Learn) to validate product/feature hypothesis
Strong ability to translate product needs to technology and understand technology
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Team player; ability to interface and build relations at all levels
Self-motivated and a desire to

Nice to have:
Experience in Identity & Authentication, including knowledge of multi-factor authentication technologies such as biometrics and industry standards such as OpenID Connect/OAuth and FIDO
Experience in product management, preferably in large consumer software & services offerings
How you will lead
Support your product management team to build a roadmap that supports Intuit’s business imperatives (big bets) and your internal and external business partners.
Work in close collaboration with other PMs and partner disciplines such as program managers, designers, development teams, legal, marketing, etc… to gather their early feedback around new Identity & Authentication scenarios and requirements; secure their buy-in; and ensure smooth execution
Deliver high quality scenarios/Epics that capture an impactful scope of work with clear KPIs/Metrics that are tracked and optimized to meet your feature goals
Features are delivered on time, and with quality. Willing to step-up and “do whatever it takes” (no job too small, or too big) to get things done

Full Job Description
Why Intern at Health Care Service Corporation?

Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), a Mutual Legal Reserve Company and an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. HCSC affiliates and subsidiaries such as Dearborn National®, TMG Health and Medecision, offer group life, disability and dental solutions, as well as a range of other individual solutions. The company, founded in 1936, serves nearly 15 million members across five states and employs more than 21,000 people in over 60 local offices. HCSC is dedicated to expanding access to high quality, cost effective health care and equipping our members with information and tools so they can make the best health care decisions for themselves and their families. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. Today, we are leaders in the development of value-based care models to spur greater collaboration and accountability among various stakeholders to improve the health care experience for patients and consumers and enable them lead healthier lives.

This ten-week paid internship is located in Richardson, TX.

Full Job Description

Job Summary

  • Are you a junior or senior pursuing a bachelors degree and looking for a career in software engineering?
  • Are you studying and living in the Greater Philadelphia Area?
  • Would you like a paying, flexible internship year-round where you'll learn and grow?
  • Do you want to work side-by-side with friendly, experienced engineers then take what you've learned back to crush your classroom projects?
  • Do you want to know you have a great job opportunity before you graduate?
  • Can you start now?

If you're thinking yes to all the above, consider an internship at Precision Systems, Inc.

Precision Systems, Inc. (PSI) has been in the business since 1984, supporting leading companies with proven expertise in developing microprocessor, embedded, PC-based products, and mobile device products. As well as providing software and firmware development services, we specialize in software related consulting and planning. Our clientele includes Fortune 500 companies, the U.S. Government, start-ups, and privately owned businesses. The industries we serve range from the medical and pharmaceutical fields to military equipment and across many commercial concerns. This varied experience provides our clients a diverse array of software development options for their applications and our engineers with new and interesting projects to take on.

PSI is seeking motivated, bright undergraduates to join the organization as Software Engineering Interns. Interns are trained and tested and once they are able to show they're preparedness, they work on real projects under the direct supervision of senior software engineers. Interns also work on internal products and projects for the company. The experience they gain is varied and highly dependent on the skills and responsibility they exhibit. This position is challenging and rewarding, and for the right person can lead to a full time opportunity upon graduation.

Responsibilities and Duties

All interns must study and be tested on PSI's standard operating procedures for software engineering, verification, change control, and configuration management. In addition, all interns must complete two practical projects that are reviewed and critiqued by other software engineers. Only after they have completed these will they be given project work. Project work varies, but it can be documentation generation, unit test creation, programming, test execution, or other project organizational tasks. The exact activities will change from week to week but the nature of the work will always be meaningful.

Qualifications and Skills

Requirements:

  • GPA of 3.5 or higher
  • This position is open only to juniors and seniors pursuing bachelor’s degree in CS, CE, IST, or other similar course of study with a focus on software programming
  • Ability to work at least 20 hours per week, year-round, in our office in Horsham, PA

Ideal Candidate:

  • You have strong communication and questioning skills
  • You have strong problem solving skills
  • You are willing to take on new challenges and tasks that lie outside your comfort zone
  • You have a desire for a long-term employment opportunity
  • You are self-starting and self-regulating
  • You have excellent time management skills
  • You can set a schedule for your availability at the start of each semester and stick to it

Benefits

This position has no additional benefits.

Full Job Description
Remote (anywhere is USA)

OUR VISION: THE WORLD. SUBSCRIBED.

Customers have changed. They’re looking for new ways to engage with businesses. Consumers today have a new set of expectations. They want outcomes, not ownership. Customization, not generalization. Constant improvement, not planned obsolescence.

In the old world (let’s call it the Product Economy) it was all about things. Acquiring new customers, shipping commodities, billing for one-time transactions. But in today’s new era, it’s all about relationships. More and more customers are becoming subscribers because subscription experiences built around services meet consumers’ needs better than the static offerings or a single product.

Our vision is “The World Subscribed” where one day every company will be a part of the Subscription Economy® (a phrase coined by our CEO, Tien Tzuo and author of the best selling book Subscribed).

THE TEAM

The Product Management team at Zuora are in the frontlines, intimately working with Zuora customers and users to identify product opportunities, functional requirements and business processes. Product Managers translate this data into product strategy, roadmap and detailed requirements that are hyper focused on business impact and customer value. Product Managers evangelize with internal and external stakeholders for buy-in and partner with engineering to bring their product to life. Additionally, Product Managers will ensure success of their product by working with their Product Marketing counterparts to drive pricing strategy, product positioning, promotional planning, product launches and product adoption strategies.

THE ROLE

Do you have a strong analytical background but would love to learn to combine that with driving business growth? Do you love driving multiple parts of a project to make an impact at the higher level? Do you enjoy making sense of data to help to drive actionable insights? Are you an organized, detail-oriented Rockstar who enjoys collaborating with others to “make shift happen”?

If so, an internship with the Zuora Platform Product Management team might be the perfect fit for you. This is your chance to:

Work alongside a world class product team
Learn about technology platforms and how they enable companies to grow and scale
Help drive scalability and make an impact to our growth
Have some fun while interning at a fantastic company

WHAT YOU’LL DO & ACHIEVE

Responsible for the data analysis, reconciliation, clean-up, and validation activities of Zuora environment data
Collaborate with cross functional teams to drive project to completion
Work with large volumes of data for extraction, transformation and tracking by leveraging appropriate tools
Analyze current manual processes surrounding tenant operations and management for optimization opportunities
Contribute to the transformation of a legacy product to help drive opportunities for revenue generation with the data analysis
Complete reconciliation of large amount of account data and mapping of data to drive project deliverables
Properly document specific processes and findings in a format that can be used for internal review
Report and communicate key metrics weekly that directly impact OKR’s to business stakeholders
Make an impact at one of the fastest growing companies in Silicon Valley and the only Cloud / SaaS company powering the Subscription Economy!

WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL

Candidate for BS / BA in Computer Science, Business Administration, Data Science or Economics
Strong written verbal and communication skills
Strong analytical and organizational skills
Able to partner with teams and influence people at all levels across functions
Strong multi-tasking across variety of critical priorities
A great attitude — hungry, humble, and willing to learn

ABOUT ZUORA & OUR “ZEO” CULTURE

Zuora (NYSE: ZUO) Zuora provides the leading cloud-based subscription management platform that functions as a system of record for subscription businesses across all industries. Powering the Subscription Economy®, the Zuora platform was architected specifically for dynamic, recurring subscription business models and acts as an intelligent subscription management hub that automates and orchestrates the entire subscription order-to-revenue process seamlessly across billing and revenue recognition. Zuora serves more than 1,000 companies around the world, including Box, Ford, Penske Media Corporation, Schneider Electric, Siemens, Xplornet, and Zoom.

At Zuora, we have one CEO but every employee is empowered and supported to be the ‘ZEO’ of their own career experience. Full Job Description

Senior Firmware Engineer / System Engineer
GeoSensorX platform products include plug and play devices for the enterprise IoT market. The hardware team is responsible for industrial design, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, supply chain, and manufacturing. This role is a key player for bringing the products to market. GSX is focused on the key creative/design/problem-solving, system specification, and bolster development resources with top JDMs, toolmakers, and suppliers. We are hiring for various experience levels.

Responsibilities:

A Firmware / System Engineer at GeoSensorX owns a project from concept through production. Some key responsibilities include:

  • Evaluate system feature tradeoffs and create the system specifications for developing FW for the target product working with the hardware design teams.
  • Assemble and bring up EVKs, board hacks, or quick-turn code for evaluating concepts and jump-starting firmware development.
  • Take a concept and create FW architecture, and implement drivers, applications with embedded OS either on your own or navigate the process with JDM resources.
  • Collaborate and select critical components to ensure the quality and timely delivery of the product software.
  • Create a test plan for each phase and applications of the product through PVT and characterize the full system for function, power, and use-cases. Validate FW quality through functional verification, power and thermal test, and full system testing
  • Partner with JDM companies to validate, certify and manufacture quality software for the target products.

Skills & Experience Required:

  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science or similar is a plus
  • 5 to 10 years of relevant experience in product development (enterprise or consumer)
  • Excellent C, C++ programming skills with experience in embedded system design and development
  • Experience with wireless communication techniques and associated protocols such as WiFi, BLE, cellular communication (LTE modules)
  • Experience in debugging embedded systems and microcontroller peripherals including I2C/SMB, SPI, UART, ADC, CAN (OBD)
  • Experience with developing project scope and project deliverables from product requirements
  • Experience in product bring up, debugging, and testing
  • Must have excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills
  • Self-starter and work with minimal supervision

We welcome all. All sizes, colors, cultures, sexes, beliefs, religions, ages, people. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that GeoSensorX is a place where people from all backgrounds can contribute and make an impact.

position: Entry Level Part-time Technical Support Specialist (College Internship)
description:
Full Job Description

National Heritage Academies (NHA) is seeking to hire a college student who is in process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or a related field. This is a part-time temporary technical support role that will be based in East Michigan providing technical support at Westfield Academy in Redford Charter Twp. The Technical Support Temp will be responsible for assisting with technical issues at our schools and assisting with technology deployment. Qualified candidates will display a strong sense of motivation to put their educational knowledge to use in a fast-paced professional environment. This is a flexible work schedule opportunity and the hiring manager is able to work around current class schedules throughout the week.

About Us
NHA is a charter school management company that operates 90+ schools across nine states serving over 60,000 students in Kindergarten through 12th grade. Founded in 1995 and based in Grand Rapids, Michigan, NHA is one of the nation’s leading for-profit charter school management organizations.

NHA’s system of schools is designed to eliminate the achievement gap and provide a public school choice to families so their children are prepared for success in high school, college, and beyond. With a commitment to hard work, good citizenship, and personal responsibility, students experience a safe, secure learning environment where achievement thrives. A passion and dedication to the mission of serving children and partnering with communities to provide an excellent educational experience permeates the culture of our organization.

Your Role

  • Respond to technical support requests (telephone, email, face-to-face)
  • Solve technical issues using remote management tools and best-practice procedures
  • Documentation and recording of solutions to assist with knowledge transfer
  • Assist with deployment of technology
  • Assist with a variety of technical projects as needed
  • Assist students and team members with computer issues and conduct repairs as necessary
  • Able to run and terminate network wiring

Requirements

  • Pursuing Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology
  • Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical people
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

company: Blue Cross Blue Shield of IL, MT, NM, OK & TX - 3.9
description:
Full Job Description
Why Intern at Health Care Service Corporation?

Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), a Mutual Legal Reserve Company and an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. HCSC affiliates and subsidiaries such as Dearborn National®, TMG Health and Medecision, offer group life, disability and dental solutions, as well as a range of other individual solutions. The company, founded in 1936, serves nearly 15 million members across five states and employs more than 21,000 people in over 60 local offices. HCSC is dedicated to expanding access to high quality, cost effective health care and equipping our members with information and tools so they can make the best health care decisions for themselves and their families. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. Today, we are leaders in the development of value-based care models to spur greater collaboration and accountability among various stakeholders to improve the health care experience for patients and consumers and enable them lead healthier lives.

This ten-week paid internship can be located in Waukegan, IL or Chicago, IL.

What Are Your Responsibilities?

This position is responsible for creating and maintaining IT process information, including measuring business objectives to IT process outputs; helping drive conversations with IT and business partners to define process requirements, and create process flows and metrics to measure success for IT Service Management processes. Participate in the creation maintenance, and reporting of one or more ITIL process area metrics, including Event Management, Configuration Management, Knowledge Management, Incident Management, and Problem Management; utilizing analytics to help implement and continually improve processes.

What Do You Need To Be Successful?

– Experience with programming is a plus
– Experience with monitoring tools is a plus
– Prior infrastructure, IT or other related internship or work experience is a plus
– Demonstrated interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication
– Strong analytical skills
– Practical, developed PC skills, especially Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook and virtual team collaboration tools

What Are the Requirements You Must Meet?

– Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in MIS, Information Security, Computer Science or other related degree
– Graduation date between December 2021 – June 2022
– A minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0
– Availability to work 10 weeks during the summer
– Unrestricted authorization to work in the United States

What Does the Internship Program Entail?

– Formal Intern Orientation to build business and industry acumen
– Challenging real-world hands-on project
– Weekly networking opportunities among interns and company leaders
– Professional development workshops
– Business Resource Group involvement
– Volunteer activities

Location:
Atlanta, GA, US

Company: Atos

About Atos

Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with 110,000 employees in 73 countries and annual revenue of € 12 billion. European number one in Cloud, Cybersecurity and High-Performance Computing, the Group provides end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications and Digital Workplace solutions. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and operates under the brands Atos, Atos|Syntel, and Unify. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the CAC40 Paris stock index.

The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education and research in a multicultural approach and contribute to the development of scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the Group enables its customers and employees, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably, in a safe and secure information space.

Position

Cybersecurity Intern

Location

Must be located in Atlanta, GA

Overview

At Atos, we have a passion for protecting people, data, and brands from today’s sophisticated threats and compliance risks. We hire the best people in the business to:

Build and improve our proven security platform
Blend innovation and speed in a constantly evolving cloud architecture
Analyze new threats and offer deep insight through data-driven intel
Collaborate with customers to help tackle their toughest security challenges

We are especially dedicated to helping our customers protect what matters most. That’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity—and why more than half of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner.

Do you want to be known as a Cyber Security Leader?
Our Managed Services Representatives guide our Managed Service customers as they plan and implement their Cyber Security Training and Awareness programs. Our representatives bring
Atos's experience and Best Practices with them. Our customers lean on us for our expertise and eye for detail.
Do you have the need for speed?
As our customer-base continues to grow and our technology solutions are constantly updated, we strive to work efficiently & effectively in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment. That means we also need to be excellent at time management and prioritizing.
Do you sweat the small stuff?
Our customers rely on us to plan their projects and ensure they go off without a hitch. We’re organized, meticulous and responsive. All details are to be considered before rolling out a program. “If it’s mentionable, it’s manageable.”
Have a desire to work independently AND part of a team?
We believe it’s meaningful to have shown the ability to work independently or part of a team. While most of the work we do is independent, we share what we know and step in to assist others on the team in order to meet the needs of all our customers.

Your day to day

Work with customers to plan their annual Security Training and Assessment program
Develop implementation and communication strategies
Build and launch training assignments, assessment campaigns and status reports
Resolve low-level technical issues as they pertain to Atos Managed Services software
Follow approved critical issue process for all other software concerns
Handle a Managed Services account load and keep an updated status for each of the Managed Services customers in our CRM system.
Must also provide detailed updates for customer interactions and planning sessions.

What you bring to the team

Currently achieving a Bachelor’s degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related subject
Minimum GPA: 3.0
Excellent written and oral communications skill
Solid grasp of SaaS
Good interpersonal and customer management skills
Demonstrated ability to develop technical skills
Excellent time management and project managment skills
Adaptive skills, learns quickly, asks questions, and solves and resolves independently
High energy, confident, and enthusiastic demeanor
Experience with HTML, Salesforce, Splunk, Microsoft Excel, Access, and Project a plus
Spanish is a plus

Here at Atos, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work. Our employee lifecycle processes are designed to prevent discrimination against our people regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes them unique. Across the globe, we have created a variety of programs to embed our Atos culture of inclusivity, and work hard to ensure that all of our employees have an equal opportunity to contribute and feel that they are exactly where they belong.

At HPE, we bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions and advance the way people live and work. Our legacy inspires us as we forge ahead dedicated to helping our customers make their mark on the world.

Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.

The performance modeling team works on state-of-the-art processor simulator and performance tools. The team looks at futuristic processors and uses simulation to estimate performance, and provide feedback to other important teams such as the compilers, performance tools, and performance engineering. This position will provide a unique opportunity to learn the intricate details about computer architecture, instruction set architecture and performance analysis

Gain experience of computer microarchitecture and instruction sets

Experience with parallel programming is a plus
Experience with assembly language is a plus

Pursuing Bachelors/Masters/PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related discipline

Full Job Description

We are currently offering a position for a CAD technician / CAD Operator. This position will involve the design of large custom industrial machinery using different CAD software. The ideal candidate has some experience with various forms of machine design including CAD design, 2-D and 3-D modeling.

Typical responsibilities for this position will include:

- Work with Project Managers and Engineers to determine the design requirements, modifications, and resolve any issues.

- Work with different CAD programs to create and work with detailed drawings, and the bill of material.

- Utilize different applications such as SolidWorks, Siemens NX, AutoCAD, Inventor, and Excel to complete drawings to meet different project deadlines.

- Efficiently produce accurate drawings for review and approval by project managers.

- Successfully work with other team members to accomplish various tasks.

- Develop and maintain standard and custom details for all product families.

Full Job Description
Waymo is an autonomous driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to get where they’re going. Since our start as the Google Self-Driving Car Project in 2009, Waymo has been focused on building the World’s Most Experienced Driver in hopes of improving the world's access to mobility while saving thousands of lives now lost to traffic crashes. Our Waymo Driver powers Waymo One, our fully autonomous ride-hailing service, as well as Waymo Via, our trucking and local delivery service. To date, Waymo has driven over 20 million miles autonomously on public roads across 25 U.S. cities and conducted over 20 billion miles of simulation testing.

Waymo's Compute Team is tasked with a critical and exciting mission: We deliver the compute platform responsible for running the fully autonomous vehicle’s software stack. To achieve our mission, we architect and create high-performance custom silicon; we develop system-level compute architectures that push the boundaries of performance, power, and latency; and we collaborate closely with many other teammates to ensure we design and optimize hardware and software for maximum performance. We are a multidisciplinary team seeking curious and talented teammates to work on one of the world’s highest performance automotive compute platforms.

Waymo interns work alongside leaders in the industry on projects that deliver significant impact to the company. We believe learning is a two-way street: leveraging your knowledge while providing you with opportunities to expand your skill-set. Interns are an important part of our culture and our recruiting pipeline. Join us at Waymo for a fun and rewarding internship!

In this internship, you’ll:
Collaborate with engineers from different teams, such as behavior or perception, to analyze and characterize our compute workload
Use this understanding of our workload to improve the performance of our systems on onboard hardware.

At a minimum we’d like you to have:
Experience programming in C++
Pursuing a BS/BA in computer science or related field
Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms

It’s preferred if you have:
Experience analyzing and understanding a real-time system
Knowledge of computer architecture on a diverse set of hardware such as CPUs, GPUs, DSPs, Neural network accelerators etc

General Perks
Help solve challenging problems with a direct impact on the company
Competitive compensation packages with a housing/relocation bonus (if applicable)
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Fun intern events and networking opportunities

Onsite Perks (These perks will only be applicable if the internship is on site)
Free breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks
Free access to Google shuttles
Onsite gym

Note: As the situation around COVID-19 remains unclear, unless otherwise stated this is going to be a remote internship position. We will accept resumes on a rolling basis until the role is filled. To be in consideration for multiple roles, you will need to apply to each one individually - please apply to the top 3 roles you are interested in.

Full Job Description

The Frostburg State University College of Education's Maryland Accelerates (MA) Program provides aspiring teachers the opportunity to earn an accelerated Master of Arts in Teaching (Elementary or Secondary track) degree along with an innovative year-long teacher residency in partnership with Frederick and Garrett County Public Schools.

Aiming to prepare and retain highly-effective educators with a focus on STEM education, the Maryland Accelerates Program provides a 12-month, $30,000 living-wage stipend during the residency portion of the program to admitted candidates. Candidates will also earn microcredentials across multiple areas (including Computational Thinking, Culturally-Responsive Pedagogy, and Classroom Management) during the program, and must complete his/her residency with either Frederick or Garrett County Public Schools. Upon graduation, teacher residents are required to apply to one of the partnering counties and commit to teaching there for a minimum of 3 academic calendar years.

Program Highlights

  • The teacher education program is nationally accredited by the National Council for the Accreditation of Teacher Education (NCATE).
  • Successful candidates are eligible for Maryland’s initial certification in grades 1-6 (Elementary track) and grades 7-12 (Secondary track).
  • The condensed experiential residency program begins each May and ends the following June.
  • Candidates will complete internships throughout the school year in Maryland professional development schools in either Frederick County, MD or Garrett County, MD.
  • The program courses are taught by dynamic professors and clinical adjuncts, and are structured to foster a collaborative and supportive cohort experience.
  • The program offers affordable in-state and out-of-state tuition.
  • While the program offers a $30,000 living stipend during the one-year residency, students are still eligible to apply for financial aid.
  • Upon successfull completion of the program, graduates recieve a Master of Arts in Teaching degree and are eligible for consideration for a full-time teaching position in participating counties (currently Frederick and Garrett) for their two-year induction program.
  • As part of the two-year induction program, graduates will be provided with support through professional development, mentoring/coaching, and additional microcredentialing for career advancement.

Eligibility Requirements

The applicant must first be accepted into the Frostburg State University Master of Arts in Teaching (MAT) Elementary of Secondary Program. In addition, the applicants to the Maryland Accelerates Teacher Residency Program must:

  • Possess a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution with a minimum 3.0 GPA;
  • For the Secondary residency track, possess a bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Biology, Chemistry, Earth Science, Physics, Math, English, or Computer Science;
  • Submit proof that they have never served as a teacher of record; and
  • Submit to and pass criminal and professional background checks.

Full Job Description

U.S. CITIZENSHIP OR GREEN CARD REQUIRED
(Note: This is due to U.S. export regulations, and we are unable to make exceptions.)

Four billion people do not have access to the internet. Astranis is going to change that. We are building the next generation of smaller, lower-cost telecommunications satellites to bring the world online.

Come work with incredibly smart people who have flown things in space before. No prior space experience needed, you just need to enjoy getting your hands dirty with real hardware and be okay with struggling to do things that seem impossibly hard.

We’re a well-funded team of over 100 world-class engineers that move fast. We raised our Series B ($90M) from Andreessen Horowitz and Venrock, launched our first satellite in 2018, secured our first major customer deal in 2019, and we’ll triple the satellite internet capacity of Alaska in 2021.

Our mission and our products are meant to connect the world and everyone in it, regardless of gender, race, creed, or any other distinction. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we encourage all people to join our team and bring their unique perspective to help make us stronger.

Role

  • RTL Development for FPGA targeted applications
  • Work with multiple FPGAs and toolchains
  • Interface FPGAs with a variety of peripherals including high speed data converters, memories, MCUs
  • Write software to interface and test RTL in hardware
  • Collaborate closely with electrical and software engineers

Requirements

  • US Citizenship or Green Card (This is a legal requirement; no exceptions)
  • Currently pursuing a B.S. or M.S. in electrical engineering, computer science, computer engineering, or equivalent
  • A passion for hardware development, including working in a fast-paced environment and hands-on design and development
  • Experience in designing, implementing, and testing high throughput systems implemented on FPGAs
  • Proficiency with Verilog/SystemVerilog for synthesis
  • Don't meet them all? Not a problem. Please apply even if you do not meet all these criteria.

Bonus

  • Experience with UVM and advanced SystemVerilog verification
  • Experience with Xilinx FPGAs
  • Experience with Vivado IDE, TCL
  • Familiarity with system level estimates and implications of power, thermal, and real estate
  • Experience with high speed data converters (ADCs, DACs, JESD204B)
  • Experience with circuit level debugging
  • Experience with digital communication theory and implementation, such as LDPC implementations
  • Experience with space-based systems
  • Experience with modern communication systems (RF, IF/IQ, time/freq domains, modulation)
  • Experience in at least 1 domain beyond logic design. This could be DSP/radio design, software, hi-rel design (e.g. fault analysis & recover), etc.

Availabilities for Fall 2020 (ASAP), Winter, Spring, and Summer 2021

Full Job Description
CommScope is seeking a Network Analyst Intern to join our team in Richardson, TX!

Learn More About Internship Programs at CommScope

As CommScope designs and builds connectivity for the world's most advanced networks, we're building something equally as important: careers for forward-thinking college students like you. Our Summer Internship Program is crafted to provide you an invaluable work experience through completing ambitious projects to help you grow and develop.

Throughout the 12-week program, you will collaborate with some of the best in the industry, receive on the job training, and participate in professional development workshops, executive speaker series, and other networking and social events!

How You'll Help Us Connect the World:
As a Network Analyst Intern, you will be responsible for assisting in the design and support of networking technologies and services. You will work closely with Network and Security Operations and Network Architecture supporting current business and IT initiatives.

You Will Make an Impact By:
Demonstrate understanding of basic networking concepts and best practices.
Provide input in the design, development, and implementation of networking technologies in support of the global network.
Perform data analytics and reporting.

Junior or Senior (if pursuing Master’s immediately upon graduation) standing preferable

CommScope is pushing the boundaries of communications technology. For more than 40 years, we’ve been leaders in innovating 5G, private networks, and Gigabit speeds everywhere – we're always anticipating what’s next. Developments such as the Internet of Things, seamless connectivity, Cloud, and 5G introduce new requirements and demand creative thinking. With our unmatched expertise in copper, fiber, and wireless infrastructure, our global clients rely on us to outperform today and be ready for the needs of tomorrow.

It is the policy of CommScope to provide Equal Employment Opportunities to all individuals based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. position: Research and Advanced Engineering – Materials/Electrification – Intern
description:
Full Job Description
Palo Alto

Ford Motor Company

Electrification

Job Description & Qualifications

At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation.

Ford’s Research and Advanced Engineering team explores new vehicle and societal innovations that require some level of invention before they can be applied to our products and services. The team is building on a history of Ford innovation, including our invention of the three-way catalytic converter to modernize vehicle emissions controls in the 1970s and the world’s first rear inflatable seat belts in 2010.

Today, we are exploring and delivering ways to make smarter vehicles and our transportation system more efficient to improve people’s lives by helping them move more freely, safely and enjoyably. For example, we are changing how our products are made by creating high-quality vehicles in an environmentally and socially responsible way, including the use sustainable materials. Since 2000, we have used 12 industry and world-first plant-based materials in our production vehicles. We also are researching the possible use of tomato skin, bamboo, agave fiber, dandelion roots, algae and coffee chaff as part of our ambitious goal of making our vehicles with up of 20 percent sustainable material by 2025.

What you will be able to do
Looking for a great answer to the question - what did you do this summer? This is it!
Through our Summer Internship, you will gain the experience, knowledge and skills to take your career to another level. Throughout this 12-week program, you will enjoy involvement in some of the groundbreaking initiatives we have happening. In addition to developing technically and professionally, you will be able to build a network of friends and contact.

Ford Greenfield Labs (GFL) - Palo Alto is leading the way to deliver breakthrough technology and services that will delight our customers. Our diverse team of employees exhibits a passion for the creative application of engineering and science to address the modern challenges of mobility. From autonomy and electrification, to smart mobility technologies and data analytics, the GFL team is bringing the best of Silicon Valley to accelerate the realization of smart vehicles for a smart world.

This role will use Design Thinking to explore work in Electrification and Advanced Materials. Charged with the development of new ideas and exploration projects, this position is focused on extensive collaboration within Ford and with external partners. This role requires an ability to leverage subject matter expertise while very quickly learning new skills, tools and technologies, especially in the areas of sustainable materials and electrification. You will:
Be an innovator
Lead exploration work streams to deliver fast-paced proof-of-concept projects
Identify and lead interactions with new diverse external partners (e.g. technology companies, start-ups, universities, labs, etc.) to expand Ford’s long-term capabilities in key areas
Use the design thinking approach to brainstorm, propose new ideas and learn from colleagues and customers
Assess, test and implement emerging technologies, particularly in the areas of sustainable materials and electrification
Collaborate within Ford and with external partners
Leverage prior subject matter expertise and adapt to quickly learn new skills, tools and technologies
Manage several projects to a timeline at once
The minimum requirements we seek
Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree, Master’s Degree or PhD in Engineering, Materials Science or Computer Science
Graduation date between December 2021 and August 2022, limited opportunities for May 2023 graduates
Our preferred requirements
Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree, Master’s Degree or PhD in Materials Science, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Sustainability Engineering or Computer Science
3.4 GPA or higher
Experience with 3D CAD, MATLAB, Data Analysis, Project Management
Strong communication skills and ability to work within diverse teams
Project experience and interest in: Energy Grid, Electrification, Sustainable Materials, Design Thinking, Materials Research and Testing

What you will receive in return
As part of the Ford family, you will enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more. You will also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition.

If you have what it takes to help us redefine the future of mobility, we would love to have you join us.

position: IT Global Infrastructure Services (GIS) Automation Development Summer Intern V
description:
Full Job Description
About our group:
As a part of the Global Infrastructure Services team, our goal is to provide reliable compute, storage and network services to all Seagate factories and design center operations. Our motto is to architect and transform our compute/storage/network systems with standard consistent architecture globally to achieve stability, service agility, simplified support, and ease of management by any Administrators across the globe. Seagate is the leader in enterprise and cloud storage solutions, 40% of the world’s data is stored on Seagate devices.

About the role - you will:
Seagate’s IT Global Infrastructure Services (GIS) organization is seeking an intern to help support and continuously improve our business processes and projects. This position reports to the Senior Manager of IT Infrastructure Services and will be located at our Fremont Research Center.

The Graduate intern will assist with our team on implementing and automating data center infrastructure initiatives and globally standardizing Kuberentes cluster services and automate infrastructure components around microservices. Intern duties will include but not limited to:

  • Creating Ansible playbooks and modules to automate system administration for distributed data centers and global infrastructure
  • Writing python code to interact with REST APIs to enhance or increase functionality of existing software deployments
  • Development of Ansible templates, playbooks integrated with Python scripts for infrastructure config automation
  • Completely automate the VM and physical server build & deployment processes through Python scripts and Ansible playbooks
  • Review the existing disparate container deployments and migrate that into standardized Kubernetes platform
Interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate.

About you:
  • Master’s Degree (in progress) in Computer Science or Business Analytics or related fields.
  • Currently enrolled student returning to school in fall 2021
  • Experience with configuration management systems such as Ansible is an advantage
  • Knowledge of TCP/IP, Linux operating system internals, file systems, disk/storage technologies and storage protocols
  • Knowledge on container-based workloads, using Kubernetes or other orchestration software
  • Proficiency in a high-level language like Python and/or Shell Scripting
  • A desire to write tools and applications to automate work rather than do things manually
  • Familiarity with tools for monitoring and system alerting (Grafana, Prometheus)
  • UNIX and Linux system administration experience: ssh, monitoring processes, attaching storage, cleaning disk space, tailing logs, etc.
  • You must be self-managed and committed to working in a fast-paced environment
  • Professional and positive communication skills
  • Previous internship and/or project experience is a plus
  • Ability to proactively identify and resolve issues
Your experience includes:
  • IT infrastructure automation through Ansible
  • Knowledge of virtualization technologies like VMWare and KVM is preferred
Location:
Location: Remote
In response to COVID-19, this position may temporarily begin and be performed remotely. Seagate is actively evaluating the virus and our employees' health and safety are our top priority. In the future, this position will report to and be performed at our Fremont, CA

Location: Fremont, CA

Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.

Is well-versed in PowerPoint and excel

Has data analysis skills

Is interested in Enterprise IT and product management

Hewlett Packard Enterprise Values:
Partnership first: We believe in the power of collaboration - building long term relationships with our customers, our partners and each other

Bias for action: We never sit still - we take advantage of every opportunity

Innovators at heart: We are driven to innovate - creating both practical and breakthrough advancements

HPE is an EOE / Female / Minority / Individual with Disabilities / Protected Veteran Status

Extensive social benefits, flexible working hours, a competitive salary and shared values, make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers. At HPE our goal is to provide equal opportunities, work-life balance, and constantly evolving career opportunities.

The Project Management Intern (PMI) is responsible for supporting the Capital Project Management group in its management and execution of Replacement and Betterment (R&B) and Growth capital projects. The PMI supports project managers and analysts as they work with various departments and stakeholders in areas of forecasting, cost tracking, scheduling, variance analysis, resource planning, procurement, document management, closeout processes, administrative functions, and other pertinent project areas.

**Employee will work remotely or hybrid due to Covid, reporting office location will be Denver or Bethlehem, PA**

Duties and Responsibilities:
Support project analysts in the development of cost estimates and financial forecasts. Assist in development of Requests For Proposal (RFP), support the project bid process, and help with comparison of proposals.
Assist in development of project schedules and tracking of key milestones, deadlines, project changes, and other aspects affecting overall project timelines. Liaise with Capital Construction and other groups to help coordinate communication of project progress and data reporting.
Assist with the closeout process for capital projects which includes documentation, as-built drawings, MTR and material data, construction job books, and other project-related material. Liaise with internal departments and external partners to help coordinate the timely processing of project documentation and records.
Help develop the Capital Project Management SharePoint website to enhance the group’s ability to store and share pertinent information. Work with IT and other departments to help create a relevant, simple, and value-added website.
Execute additional duties and responsibilities as required.
