Exceptionally organized with strong attention to detail.
Financial/accounting acumen; ability to analyze project data, identify key information, and present findings to team members.
Proficient with Microsoft Office programs (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Project, etc.); ability to learn and become proficient with company-specific software/programs.
Ability to build strong relationships and develop trust; collaborative, team-focused, and service-oriented.
Strong communication skills; communicate effectively and persuasively, both verbally and in writing.

Full Job Description
Build the analytics to help Flexport grow

The opportunity:
As a Data Analytics Intern, you will work alongside self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficiencies in the complex global trade industry. You'll have the opportunity to improve an industry by analyzing the new operating system for global trade. You will own and work through an entire data analytics project end-to-end over 12 weeks.

It will ultimately culminate in delivering a production ready feature and presenting it and your process to our team. The Data Analytics team at Flexport has an enormous variety in the types of projects they work on and covers all Flexport departments, including Growth Marketing, Operations Excellence, Ocean Procurement, and everything in between.

You will:
Lead and complete at least one data analytics project that will be used in production.
Work with a supportive mentor who has a stake in your success and will help you grow.
Work cross-functionally with the entirety of Flexport - analytics, engineering, product, and business teams.
Apply analytical and statistical concepts from your education and work experience to real world challenges.
Learn and use our modern analytics tech stack, including dbt, Airflow, Snowflake, and Looker.

You should have:
Rising senior actively pursuing a Bachelor's degree in a STEM field, or have previous internship experience in an analyst role.
Completed coursework in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related fields.
SQL fluency, with experience using a scripting language like Python or R. Strong Excel fundamentals a plus.
Experience with data visualization tools (Looker preferred).

You will get:
An assigned manager and mentor who will be dedicated to your success at Flexport.
Projects and assignments which will help build your knowledge and skills while making a direct impact on the business.
Visibility to leaders within the organization and opportunities to present your work/projects.
Opportunity to join team building activities to get you familiarized with both your immediate team and other Flexport employees.

Bonus:
Bring experience and/or knowledge of something we can learn from you! Internships are at their best when they're bi-directional.
We value culture adds, not culture fits, so bring your full, authentic self!

About Flexport:
We believe global trade can move the human race forward. That's why it's our mission to make global trade easier for everyone. We aim to do this by building the Operating System for Global trade - a strategic model combining advanced technology and data analytics, logistics infrastructure, and supply chain expertise. Flexport today connects almost 10,000 clients and suppliers across 109 countries, including established global brands like Georgia-Pacific as well as emerging innovators like Sonos. Started in 2013, we've raised over $1.3B in funding from SoftBank Vision Fund, Founders Fund, GV, First Round Capital and Y Combinator. We're excited about the three big ways we're moving forward after our recent $1B investment from SoftBank Vision Fund in February 2019.

Worried about not having any freight forwarding experience?
Don't be! We're building the first Operating System for Global Trade. That's why it's incredibly important for us to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the freight forwarding industry forward.
What's freight forwarding and why does it matter? Freight forwarding is the coordination and shipment of goods from one place to another and it's what makes global trade possible. Flexport is on a mission to make global trade easier for everyone because we believe it can help connect the world and break down economic barriers.
We know this industry is complex. That's why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.

At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global trade easy for everyone relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

ABOUT TURNITIN:
Turnitin is a global company dedicated to ensuring the integrity of education and meaningfully improving learning outcomes. For more than 20 years, Turnitin has partnered with educational institutions to promote honesty, consistency, and fairness across all subject areas and assessment types. Our products are used by educators to guide their students towards higher standards of integrity and by students, researchers and professionals to do their best, original work.

Turnitin has offices in Australia, India, Indonesia, Japan, Korea, Mexico, the Netherlands, the Philippines, Ukraine, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Over 15,000 academic institutions, publishers, and corporations use our services: Feedback Studio, Gradescope, iThenticate, Turnitin Originality, Turnitin Similarity and ExamSoft.

OUR VALUES:
Authenticity: Showing up as who we truly are. Representing integrity in our products. Willing to say tough/unpopular things.

Action & Ownership: Acting quickly, like owners, with a bias for action. Always growing, and changing, avoiding the blame game.

Global Mindset: Considering different perspectives, celebrating diversity. Acting like one team. Recognizing the work we do has an impact on the world.

Passion for Learning: Helping educators and learners on the global front. Committing to our own learning and growth. Upholding our corporate social responsibility to education.

Job Description

TEAM DESCRIPTION:
The Search Engine Unit Team focuses on the document processing pipeline, report generation, and content intake/web crawler infrastructure at Turnitin.

We are the core of the integrity solutions across the TurnItIn product, working with multiple product lines that all call into our service with submissions, producing reports that achieve our best in class quality for integrity verification. The team culture is best described as “no-nonsense small group of engineers” and our pace and environment are flexible and also informal. Our team includes a diverse mix of nationality, race, college majors and also spans quite an age range. We value diversity in background and thought and know it is crucial to the success of our team. We are looking for someone who likes solving hard problems and writing elegant solutions to those problems and also is easy to talk with and enjoys hanging out with the team also.

WHAT YOU’LL DO AND ACHIEVE:
You will be introduced to the ecosystem that we live in, learn the architectures and then be assigned a mentor with whom you will focus on extending and refactoring one of our apps. We are light on process and a very personal group, so there will be a few meetings you will be part of, but otherwise there will be a lot of time coding the solution and also writing tests. Some of the tasks you will be asked to do will require some research (non-obvious solutions) and assessment of possible solutions.

Qualifications

Current US undergraduate student who will graduate by June 2022

Computer science major with experience in theory/systems/networks

Understanding of REST

Proficient in Golang (though experience with Java/C++ can substitute)

Proficient with the command line + Linux + git

Understanding of test-driven development and CICD processes

Nice to have:
Experience using AWS services (Lambda, SQS, S3, etc)

Understanding of Kubernetes + terraform

Additional Information

No agency submissions

At Unity, you’ll make a difference. We’re democratizing development, solving hard problems, and enabling the success of our Community in a collaborative, fast-growing environment. You and your desire to make the world a better place will be at the forefront of the real-time revolution, as we create exciting technological advancements in entertainment, film, retail, sales, and other industries – all made possible by the Unity Engine, the most widely used 3D development platform in the world.

We are looking for Full Stack Software Engineers to join our highly dynamic teams in San Francisco, Bellevue, or Austin, and focus on building and delivering solutions across our monetization and operation solutions for game developers, such as Advertising, In-App-Purchase, Game Analytics, and Game Optimization.

Strong communication skills, both in person and via digital means with the ability to work in a team environment

Unity is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

The company’s 1,400+ person research and development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than three billion times per month in 2019 on more than two billion unique devices. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Full Job Description
Commvault is a worldwide leader in delivering backup and recovery for the progressive enterprise. Commvault enables you to protect, manage, and use your data, while managing it in a consistent, compliant way. Our automated solutions work on-prem and in the cloud, and work with the digital tools and procedures you’re already using. Keep your data accessible and actionable with a single solution that ensures your data is always available — no matter what.

Our 2021 Summer internship program is now open!

We are looking for our next Products intern. Our summer internship program isn’t just a summer job we offer real world experience, reasonability’s and opportunities to make an impact in a global organization.

What you’ll do on a typical day: Hint there is no such thing but…

– Pick up subtle differences both visually and functionally, with the software.

– Standardize and improve our modern interface Commvault Command Center

– Work on projects across the product landscape and touch upon technologies like cloud virtualization, containers, and databases.

– Inspect and ensure all APIs are providing enough robust information, that if this information was passed through a SIEM/SOAR application, security teams, CSOs and data forensic engineers can leverage this for root cause analysis of whatever they are inspecting.

The Fine Print: (What you will need to be successful)

Currently enrolled in a full time Bachelors or Masters program at an accredited university through the 2021-2022 semester.

Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

Available to work full time during the summer from approximately Memorial Day to Labor Day

A great eye for detail, technical aptitude, and eagerness to learn in a fast paced environment of innovation!

Full Job Description
Piano Overview

Piano is a fast-growing enterprise SaaS company with operations in Philadelphia, New York City, Buenos Aires, Amsterdam, London, Oslo, Paris, Berlin, Singapore, Tokyo, and elsewhere globally. We provide enterprise software and strategic services to the world’s leading media companies, including NBC Universal, the Economist, Dow Jones, BBC, Techcrunch, Bloomberg, Le Parisien, Gannett, Mainichi Shimbun, and more than 400 other clients. The company is now at an inflection point as it aggressively moves into other industries outside of media. Our software and services enable these companies to create customized digital experiences for users, restrict and sell access to content online, and analyze user behavior in order to drive engagement, loyalty, and revenue.

Project Scope

We are bringing on a Client Technology Intern to help us build a dashboard for our middleware project called Staccato. For context, there are several connectors built between Piano’s applications and 3rd party systems such as Zendesk, Salesforce, and Client Success. Some of these connectors are used internally, and some are used by clients. We expect client adoption to increase in the short term along with more connectors being developed. However, there's currently no central tool that allows us to monitor the status of these connectors. The project would address this need by building an internal dashboard that would display the basic settings of each connector, plus provide at-a-glance information of the number and IDs of Piano apps connected to it, and the health of the connections.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Development of the Staccato dashboard as detailed in this document
Participation in code review of their and others' code
Shadowing & assisting in solutioning, implementation, and optimization projects
Production of documentation about the software developed and related processes

We are looking for someone with a mix of the following skills:

Rising junior or senior pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar
Demonstrated proficiency in full-stack web development with a preference for JavaScript/Typescript or Python
Experience with at least one modern front-end (Angular/React) or back-end (Express/Django/Laravel/Rails) framework
HTML5/CSS3
APIs/Integrations

Raytheon Applied Signal Technology is a diversified intelligence and defense company that develops systems to provide integrated sensor and signal processing products in support of intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance.

Our Engineering Division has a need for an Infrastructure Engineering Intern to design, develop, integrate, and maintain advanced high-capacity systems that process modern high-speed communications for the US intelligence community. The effective candidate shall be skilled at the integration and maintenance of a product, including debugging issues to root causes. The effective candidate will also have a excellent understanding of concepts related to networking, software architecture, and standard programming practices.

The candidate will work with other experienced developers in our Salt Lake City office for the protection of our country. The successful candidate will also generate briefings and present material clearly to team members, customers, and Raytheon Applied Signal Technology management as necessary

This position can be a Salary Grade of G04, G05 or NUG based on the candidate's qualifications as they relate to the skills, experience and responsibility requirements for the position.
  • G04 (College Junior by Fall 2021) - must have completed 60 hours of college
  • G05 (College Senior by Fall 2021) - must have completed 90 hours of college
  • NUG (Post- Graduate-Masters-PhD by Fall 2021) - must have an undergraduate degree and currently enrolled or about to enroll in a graduate degree program
Requirements:
  • Must be a college Junior, Senior or Graduate student by Fall 2021
  • Experience in C/C++
  • Working knowledge of Linux or Unix
  • Software development experience (i.e. internship, co-op, team based projects, etc.)
  • Experience with Object Oriented Design and Development
  • Experience with multi-threaded code
  • Experience verifying and validating the software and system work as intended
  • Experience working both in a team environment and individually
  • Experience developing, coding, testing, and debugging complex algorithms
  • U.S. Citizenship
  • Ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance

  • ABET is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard
  • Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA (Please upload an unofficial transcript when applying)
  • Understanding of standard system engineering design artifacts such as Use Cases
  • Exposure to Communications Systems and theory and Signal Processing concepts
  • Experience with Object Oriented Design and Development
  • Experience with Configuration Management tools, such as git
  • Experience with scripting languages such as Python and Perl
  • Experience with UI development
  • Experience with Qt
  • Experience and/or knowledge of network protocols, such as TCP/IP
  • Experience with or basic understanding of telecommunications systems concepts and/or signal processing
  • Experience with system-level integration and testing, specifically, the integration of advanced, custom processing systems, testbeds, and software
Required Education: Currently pursuing a BS / BA degree from a four-year university and entering as a college Junior or Senior year OR pursuing a MS / MA / PhD by Fall 2021. Must be working towards a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics Major, or equivalent technical discipline. Must be appropriate grade level listed above.175897

Full Job Description
Overview and Summary:
Urban Science is a business-solutions company focused on supporting the needs of the sales and marketing function of the automotive industry. We leverage a scientific methodology to help our client partners sell more vehicles, improve profitability and increase customer loyalty. And we do that by helping solve their toughest challenges including planning an optimal dealership network, improving individual dealer performance, and efficiently converting sales leads into sales. In short, we guide business through science—and we’ve been doing this since 1977.

OVERVIEW

The IT Operations Intern will support the End User Computing function within the Enterprise Applications team, assisting Urban Science end users with their desktop, laptop, and mobile devices hardware and software needs.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Apply knowledge of most desktop technologies and the company specific environment configurations to analyze and solve a wide range of issues in the desktop computing environment.
Responsible for assisting with troubleshooting, setting up new users, configuring mobile devices, fixing printer issues, and rebuilding computers.
Maintain the office phone system by creating new users, moving phone locations and extensions, setting up email and troubleshooting phone system problems.
Identify equipment requirements including hard drives, phone and other technical equipment in accordance with corporate guidelines.
Provide an initial level of support for server based application solutions.
Provide guidance and assistance to employees to ensure they have the right technology and that it is configured properly.
Assure software license and asset information is properly maintained.
Participate in IT Operations projects encompassing a range of technologies as needs arise.
Operate IT service management system to dispatch and maintain tickets to facilitate proper ticket flow and accurate data in reporting.

Qualifications - Education and Experience:
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND COMPETENCIES

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, abilities, and competencies required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Preferred basic knowledge of:
End User Computing configuration management tools, Microsoft Configuration Manager (SCCM), and Microsoft Intune
Modern workplace technologies, including but not limited to Microsoft Power Platform, Office 365, Microsoft Teams and Skype for Business
Scripting tools, endpoint protection tools, and security tools - PowerShell, Bitlocker, Windows Defender and Cloud App Security
Identifying repeatable tasks that are candidates for automation, orchestration, and empowering end users with self service capabilities, to drive efficiency
Available computing and/or network hardware and peripheral equipment.
Computer and/or network security systems, applications, procedures, and techniques.
Current technological developments/trends in area of expertise preferred.
Federal copyright laws as they pertain to the use of computer software

Able to learn how to:
Troubleshoot installations or implementations.
Install, configure and maintain personal computers, and/or related hardware and software.
Identify and resolve computer system malfunctions and operational problems.
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical personnel, assessing audience need and adjusting level of detail accordingly.
Ability to write clear and concise work instructions using a defined template.
Ability to work within defined processes.
Ability to prioritize competing demands, manage multiple concurrent tasks and adapt to changing priorities.
Must maintain high level of confidentiality.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Currently pursuing a Baccalaureate degree in an appropriate IT field such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Management Information Systems from an accredited U.S. college or university, equivalent foreign institution, or equivalent experience.
Current Microsoft certifications preferred.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

This description is intended to describe the type and level of work being performed by a person assigned to this position. It is NOT an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities required by a person so classified. The job may require additional hours beyond the normal 40-hour workweek.

Full Job Description
Southington, CT, USA Req #356
Thursday, February 18, 2021
Who we are...
COCC delivers complete enterprise processing solutions to financial institutions throughout the northeastern United States. Listed among American Banker's FinTech 100 and the Inc. 5,000 fastest growing companies in the nation, COCC inspires the industry with innovation and top quality support. Designated as a Top Workplace in Connecticut, COCC recognizes employees as the core of our success! COCC offers a progressive training program to support employees in personal and professional development.

We are currently seeking exceptional interns interested in pursuing a career in Information Technology. This is an excellent opportunity for talented individuals to gain valuable, hands-on experience at a growing, award-winning technology company and participate in a professional, comprehensive remote summer learning experience! Ideal candidates will be highly motivated rising college seniors with a passion for learning and delivering quality service. Our paid interns will work a 30 hour work week for a period of 10 to 12 weeks beginning on Tuesday, June 1, 2021. As part of our intern program, you will participate in fun virtual team building events and take part in a collaborative project to cap off your learning experience! Our 2021 interns will work remotely.

Some of the Internships Available: (Please indicate preference on application/cover letter)

Accounting - Opportunity to learn and support various areas of accounting including Accounts Payable, Receivable, Procurement and assisting with audits and ad hoc reporting. As well as an opportunity to support our Financial Management product through data analysis for client conversions and other support projects. Both teams are looking for a detailed oriented Accounting or Finance major
Application Analyst – Work on maintenance requests, identify where within the database the developer needs to make a change, quality assurance (QA) test developers code before turning it over for customer acceptance test. Any applicable major with some knowledge of MS Office suite of tools, especially Outlook, analytical skills (data, business or application), SQL, relational database knowledge and communication skills
Automated Testing - Work within ALM (Micro Focus Application Lifecycle Management) and UFT (Micro Focus Unified Functional Testing) to write new automated tests to add to our existing test suites for COCC’s iBanking, INSIGHT and eOpen platforms. Work with platform analysts to troubleshoot and correct issues with existing automated tests and enhance existing automated tests. A Computer Science/Technical background with some knowledge/experience with higher level language, relational database and OO concepts preferred.
Business Development- Various projects to support our Business Development/Sales function including administrative tasks tied to Prospect Demonstration coordination (giveaway/promotional item ordering, lunch ordering, submitting WRS tickets, purchase requisitions, UPS forms, etc.) Majors related to Communications, Business, MIS, Marketing preferred
Configuration – Get in on the ground floor as we launch our latest iBanking/iMobile upgrade! Update feature functions that the app can access enterprise-wide and assist with client support for our new Maverick theme. A major in Computer Science or MIS preferred.
Digital Communications – Work on a variety of projects such as assisting with internal and client communications including employee emails, basic SharePoint updates, website updates, PowerPoint presentations, manuals, etc. Majors related to web and graphic design preferred. Experience with HTML, CSS, and graphic design (Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator) strong writing and grammatical skills with excellent attention to detail required.
iBanking Analyst - Opportunity to work with our popular mobile banking app including testing, bug fixes and enhancements. A background in computer science, business or finance needed. Must be able to work independently, highly organized and analytical. Previous analyst experience a plus
Item Processing- Great opportunity for someone interested in business or accounting. Will be able to assist the IP Specialist with a full audit of Item Processing billing, amongst other projects including pricing. Accounting or Business major preferred. Needs to have an intermediate level of Excel skills.
IT Security – Positions available in both Secure-hosting and cyber-threat detection/security operations. Coordinate technical projects, participate in follow-ups and planning/documentation, and perform daily checks – platform excellence, inbox/ticket review, troubleshooting, password resets. Potential to develop Splunk queries/dashboards. Majors in IT/Data/Networking with knowledge of/experience with networking/IT/cybersecurity or data analytics desirable.
Information Technology- Opportunities in both Networking as well as general IT focused on desktop support with exposure to virtualization. Degrees in IT/Data/Networking with skills in various IT systems
Lending Solutions - Great for students with an interest in finance and banking. This is a great opportunity to work with leading edge software used in the lending market. Data analysis, tracking project milestones and assisting with client support are all major ingredients of this internship. A major in Business or Finance and intermediate Excel skills are necessary.
Software Development – Several positions available! Create, compile and unit test all code changes for maintenance requests as well as issue/problem resolution, assist in the troubleshooting of application problems, operate with our systems development life cycle when coding, testing and implementing changes, internal tool enhancement. Computer Science majors encouraged. Some experience/knowledge of any of the following are a plus: Oracle, PL/SQL, scripting, Python, C#, Java, web development, TypeScript, React, JavaScript
Vendor Management - Assist with vendor research, score cards, system updates and maintaining Excel spreadsheets. Degree in Business or Technical related studies preferred. Must be proficient in Excel, detail oriented and a critical thinker.

Qualifications:
  • Must be a rising Senior enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program in MIS, Computer Science, Finance or business related field
  • Professional demeanor with ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with all levels of the organization
  • Ability to work successfully both independently and as part of a team
  • Academic experience and a passion for working with technology applications is a plus
  • Preference given to students with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher inclusive of all college coursework
COCC is committed to maintaining a drug-free workplace. All applicants are required to pass a credit, background, and substance test prior to employment. COCC procures background and consumer reports in compliance with all Federal and State regulations, including The Fair Credit Reporting Act and CT Department of Labor laws regarding pre-employment screens. COCC is an equal opportunity employer committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Full Job Description
About our group:
The mission of the End User Services organization is to enable the success of Seagate employees by providing exceptional services that set the standard for customer service, quality, professionalism, business technology and cost optimization. To adapt to challenges on the horizon, End User Services must continually innovate new processes and embrace new platforms. End User Services is part of Corporate IT.

About the role - you will:
Leverage your creativity in solving complex hardware and software issues related to an end user’s computer.
Gain valuable insight in troubleshooting network connectivity, application, hardware, audio visual and telephony equipment problems faced by our end user community.
Learn how to quickly adapt to situations faced by the end user in a fast-paced environment.
Gain real world experience in configuring, deploying, maintaining and troubleshooting computer hardware in an enterprise environment.
Obtain a general understanding of the Active Directory environment.
Learn how to follow processes and procedures to ensure a high quality of work is delivered to the end-user with minimal disruptions.
Build experience with maintaining password security, data integrity, and file system security for the laptop environment utilizing Bitlocker.
Document trouble tickets from inception through closure in an Enterprise Incident Management System such as Service Now.
Gain experience with Microsoft’s System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) and Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager (MECM).
Follow Seagate Technology’s COVID protocols such as daily temperature screening, daily health screening questionnaire, social distancing, mandatory mask wearing and hand sanitization.
Work Mon-Fri, 8 am MT-5 pm MT. There are no work-from-home opportunities for this position.

About you:
You are an excellent communicator, both verbally and in written form. You must be able to communicate with customers, peers, and management concerning the status of cases, problems, or suggestions.
You can demonstrate experience in creating and executing innovative solutions to solve complex technical support problems.
You have experience using critical thinking skills to identify and resolve technical issues.
You have the ability to take proactive, corrective actions, to resolve issues in advance of system problems.

Your experience includes:
Pursing a Bachelor’s or technical degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software engineering or a related degree program and enrolled in Fall 2021 courses.
A general understanding of computer hardware and software troubleshooting and issue resolution.
You can demonstrate knowledge of Office 365 online applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive and OneNote) and Windows 10 OS.

You May Also Have:
Relevant Technical Certifications a plus, including Microsoft, A+ and HDI preferred.
Hands-on experience in Information Technology solutions and services.

Location:
Our Longmont product-design campus is nestled against the foothills with exceptional views of the Rocky Mountains. Here at work, you can grab breakfast and lunch in the on-site cafeteria or get an afternoon espresso, prepared by a professional barista. Our 1,500+ employees enjoy an active on-site experience from sporting activities (get in a few laps at lunch on our 1-mile walking path around campus, play ping-pong or volleyball, or stop in our 24- hour fitness center for a group or individual workout) to community service and many employee resource groups including Pride!, Women’s Leadership Network and a Young Professionals Network.

#intern

Local candidates preferred

Full Job Description
DevSecOps Engineering interns should be working towards a Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related Discipline. There is no professional work experience required for this position. Cybernet will provide on-the-job training to the individual under the direct supervision of one of our Cybersecurity professionals. A background in Windows and Linux operating systems is required.

Full Job Description

Acciona is looking for a SCADA/Network Engineer Summer Intern to start in May/June for 10-12 weeks in the Chicagoland area. This is a great opportunity to work closely with our Operations & Maintenance team in the renewable energies sector. Under the guidance of experienced engineering professionals the Engineer Intern will develop skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the AEUG business and operations and maintenance activities.

o Training opportunities may include participation in different projects/areas, working with Acciona engineering and maintenance professionals that support operational engineering functions, which includes Wind and Solar PV/Storage.

o Experience and exposure may include, but is not limited to, the different stages of a project life cycle: development, preconstruction, construction, operations and maintenance.

o Training opportunities include technical training, training on specific competencies, monitoring and evaluating individual performance, and feedback from the mentoring supervisor throughout the program.

o Increased knowledge of renewable power generation SCADA systems

o Exposure to Acciona’s Network Operations Center, network diagrams, and SCADA communication and functionality,

o Opportunity to travel to and visit operating assets.

o Carry out duties in accordance with AEUG health, safety, environment, and quality policies, principles, corporate values, and strategies.

o Capacity to work on varied activities, managing multiple simultaneous projects in a fast-paced environment

o High attention to detail and commitment to produce high quality outputs

Full Job Description
Applied Research Associates, Inc. has an outstanding internship opportunity for a full-time student who is currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program and wants to gain related work experience supporting in the field of computational science. The qualified intern will be part of an interdisciplinary team that models and simulates a variety of physical effects on structures and the environment. Projects may include developing new computational capabilities using existing physics based models, generating advanced 3D visualization of complex simulations, performing statistical analysis of results from many simulations, and conducting simulations using high performance computers.

Required Qualifications:
Ability to program in Python, Fortran, or C++
Eagerness to learn new tools and techniques
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Familiarity with computational approaches for mechanics of materials (stress, strain, etc).
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance
Must be a currently enrolled, full-time student in a Bachelor’s Degree program or above in Computational Science, Computer Science, Physics, Mechanical Engineering, or related field at an accredited university

Desired Experience:
Experience programming in Python
Experience with Monte Carlo simulation methods
Experience using non-commercial physics models

COMPANY INFORMATION:
Applied Research Associates, Inc. is an employee-owned international research and engineering company recognized for providing technically superior solutions to complex and challenging problems in the physical sciences. The company, founded in Albuquerque, NM, in 1979, currently employs over 1200 professionals. ARA offices throughout the United States and Canada provide a broad range of technical expertise in defense technologies, civil technologies, computer software and simulation, systems analysis, environmental technologies, and testing and measurement. The corporation also provides sophisticated technical products for environmental site characterization, pavement analysis, and robotics.

At ARA, employees are our greatest assets. The corporation realizes that employee ownership spawns greater creativity and initiative along with higher performance and customer satisfaction levels. ARA gives its employees the tools, training, and opportunities to take more active roles as owners. The culture is challenging; innovation and experimentation are the norm. Employees are eligible for contributions which not only add to the company’s success, but also their own through the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). The motto, “Engineering and Science for Fun and Profit” sums up the ARA experience. For additional information and an opportunity to join this unique workplace, please visit our website at www.ara.com.

Please apply at www.careers.ara.com for the Computational Science Intern position.

description:
Full Job Description
Why Intern at Health Care Service Corporation?

The Health Data Exchange Intern will be part of an important large scale initiative to advance healthcare interoperability and strengthen collaboration in order to improve patient care. This position is responsible for meaningful work involving the adoption, operations and/or delivery of capabilities needed to support and expand Health Data Exchange. Responsibilities will include: fostering strong relationships with external and internal stakeholders; addressing issues / risk from stakeholders; coordinating comprehensive solutions; and proactively identifying improvements to health data exchange capability delivery.

Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), a Mutual Legal Reserve Company and an Independent Licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association, is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. HCSC affiliates and subsidiaries such as Dearborn National®, TMG Health and Medecision, offer group life, disability and dental solutions, as well as a range of other individual solutions. The company, founded in 1936, serves nearly 15 million members across five states and employs more than 21,000 people in over 60 local offices. HCSC is dedicated to expanding access to high quality, cost effective health care and equipping our members with information and tools so they can make the best health care decisions for themselves and their families. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. Today, we are leaders in the development of value-based care models to spur greater collaboration and accountability among various stakeholders to improve the health care experience for patients and consumers and enable them lead healthier lives.

This ten-week paid internship is located in Chicago, IL.

What Are Your Responsibilities?

– Support key healthcare interoperability, data analysis and reporting initiatives
– Perform operational duties as assigned to develop expertise in Health Data Exchange, business analysis, process improvement and project management
– Anticipate and solve problems by providing analytic and customer support
– Evaluate business requirements and recommend solutions

What Do You Need To Be Successful?

– Desire for purposeful and substantive work
– Exposure to EMR/EHR systems, HIE, HL7, SQL, Tableau or other related tools is a plus
– Prior Healthcare or Data Analytics Internship experience is a plus
– Demonstrated interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication
– Strong analytical and practical problem solving skills
– Critical and creative thinking skills
– Practical, developed PC skills, especially MS Office Suite and virtual team collaboration tools

What Are the Requirements You Must Meet?

– Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Health Informatics, Healthcare Administration, IT, Public Health, STEM or other related degree/major
– Graduation date between December 2021 – June 2022
– A minimum GPA of 3.0/4.0
– Availability to work 10 weeks during the summer
– Unrestricted authorization to work in the United States

What Does the Internship Program Entail?

– Formal Intern Orientation to build business and industry acumen
– Challenging real-world hands-on project
– Weekly networking opportunities among interns and company leaders
– Professional development workshops
– Business Resource Group involvement
– Volunteer activities

Full Job Description
Description

The IT Intern is an entry level role responsible for providing, with guidance, IT services and support to enhance departments’ operational efficiencies, patient safety and departmental workflow needs. The expectation for this position would be to gain experience and abilities required for an IT role in a healthcare organization. Under direct supervision, the IT Intern responsibilities include:

Participates, with guidance, in needs assessment, software design, development, implementation, support, and reporting.
Assists with data collection from subject matter experts, to facilitate design which will represent an improved system workflow.
Assists with the design of system workflow in conjunction with clinical and business partners; workflows will focus on improved efficiencies, as well as incorporating quality initiatives.
Provides desktop or technical support.
Participates in change management activities to support successful system deployments and enhancements.
Participates in unit and integrated testing of the software to ensure that the design objectives are met.
Assists with the development of end-user training materials and supports training efforts.
Assists other team members in ensuring good documentation standards; including the creation of functional design specifications.
Provides input into escalation of issues with appropriate internal resources.
Assists in the development of policies and procedures in collaboration with clinicians, business personnel, other team members, and IT manager.
Assists with the development and maintenance of system documentation.
Works tickets assigned through the Service Desk ticket tool.
Troubleshoots issues with vendor assistance, to resolution.
Supports/troubleshoots Hospital Information Systems inbound/outbound interfaces as appropriate.
Creates reports as needed and works problem tickets.
Works with other application analysts to insure system integrations.
Utilizes and maintains appropriate change control procedures and standards.
Prepares detailed flowcharts/diagrams to assist with design decisions and problem analysis.
Rotates to various IT teams for exposure and experience.
Performs other duties as assigned.

  • This role may encounter Protected Health Information (PHI) as part of regular responsibilities. UH employees must abide by all requirements to safely and securely maintain PHI for our patients. Annual training, the UH Code of Conduct and UH policies and procedures are in place to address appropriate use of PHI in the workplace.
Qualifications

Experience & Knowledge:
Must have strong written and verbal communication skills.
Must be detail-oriented and organized, with good analytical and problem solving ability.
Notable client service, communication, and relationship building skills required.
Ability to work in hospital clinical and office areas where patient safety and confidentiality are core values required.
Must have reliable transportation and be flexible to work varying shifts.

Special Skills & Equipment Knowledge:
Demonstrated ability to use PCs, Microsoft Office suite, and general office equipment (i.e. printers, copy machine, FAX machine, etc.) required.

Education:
High School diploma or GED required.
Active college student or recent graduate with a Bachelor degree in any of the following, or comparable: Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Management, Healthcare- related degree, Programming, Engineering, required.

Full Job Description
Piano Overview

Piano is a fast-growing enterprise SaaS company with operations in Philadelphia, New York City, Buenos Aires, Amsterdam, London, Oslo, Paris, Berlin, Singapore, Tokyo, and elsewhere globally. We provide enterprise software and strategic services to the world’s leading media companies, including NBC Universal, the Economist, Dow Jones, BBC, Techcrunch, Bloomberg, Le Parisien, Gannett, Mainichi Shimbun, and more than 400 other clients. The company is now at an inflection point as it aggressively moves into other industries outside of media. Our software and services enable these companies to create customized digital experiences for users, restrict and sell access to content online, and analyze user behavior in order to drive engagement, loyalty, and revenue.

Project Scope

We are bringing on a Client Technology Intern to help us build a dashboard for our middleware project called Staccato. For context, there are several connectors built between Piano’s applications and 3rd party systems such as Zendesk, Salesforce, and Client Success. Some of these connectors are used internally, and some are used by clients. We expect client adoption to increase in the short term along with more connectors being developed. However, there's currently no central tool that allows us to monitor the status of these connectors. The project would address this need by building an internal dashboard that would display the basic settings of each connector, plus provide at-a-glance information of the number and IDs of Piano apps connected to it, and the health of the connections.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Development of the Staccato dashboard as detailed in this document
Participation in code review of their and others' code
Shadowing & assisting in solutioning, implementation, and optimization projects
Production of documentation about the software developed and related processes

We are looking for someone with a mix of the following skills:

Rising junior or senior pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or similar
Demonstrated proficiency in full-stack web development with a preference for JavaScript/Typescript or Python
Experience with at least one modern front-end (Angular/React) or back-end (Express/Django/Laravel/Rails) framework
HTML5/CSS3
APIs/Integrations

position: Corporate Governance, Business Excellence Summer Intern
description:
Full Job Description
About our group:
Business Excellence enables sustainable enterprise-wide operational improvement and transformation to support and secure Seagate's growth in the data industry. Moving beyond standards and compliance, we provide a singular set of structures spanning people, process, technology to enable our sustained performance.

About the role - you will:
Research and summarize a global 5 year roadmap for enterprise future footprint based on new emerging work standards, costs, markets. large, cross-functional. Responsibilities will include research of functional centers of excellence, utilities, quality of life, and other factors for recommendation by world geos.
Implement an annual planning meeting for the business excellence global function to ensure aligned annual plan for goals, objectives and results. Integrate best practice planning tools and learnings for Business Excellence function leading to SMART and effective performance management through the fiscal year. Collaborate with colleagues to enable the infrastructure and operational cadence of these goals-based processes. Provide infrastructure for annual cadence (calendar, video tools, SharePoint site management) to enable.
Research relevant Business Excellence areas of excellence (ESG, Work Structures, Product Security, EHS,...) for a point view on future planning functions.
Leverage organization excellence to advise, develop and deploy tools for functional briefs and cadence supporting business excellence.
Effectively communicate and influence, cross-functionally, to achieve project outcomes and established cadence. Develop and deliver project status presentations and videos, including process models, supporting metrics, business requirements, improvement recommendations, etc.
Recognize barriers to improvement efforts and effectively work to remove them.
Utilize a Business Process Management (BPM) System (Signavio) to create process flows and other attributes (RACI, SIPOC, etc) using BPM Notation in support of responsibilities.
Manage relationships with key stakeholders and subject matter experts.

About you:
You have excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with various levels of management.
You exhibit strong organization skills, ability to prioritize multiple tasks, and manage multiple projects to meet deadlines.
You demonstrate the highest level of integrity.
You are trustworthy, while working well independently and as a team.
You are able to work 40 hrs a week through the summer 2021.

Your experience includes:
Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration (Accounting, Finance, Operations, Management, etc) or Computer Science/Engineering (projects about websites, productivity tools, and analytics) and enrolled in Fall 2021 courses
Education includes understanding where/how technology or new business process models address business challenges.
Proficiency in the use of Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Sharepoint, Teams (Microsoft applications).

Location:
Our Longmont product-design campus is nestled against the foothills with exceptional views of the Rocky Mountains. Here at work, you can grab breakfast and lunch in the on-site cafeteria or get an afternoon espresso, prepared by a professional barista. Our 1,500+ employees enjoy an active on-site experience from sporting activities (get in a few laps at lunch on our 1-mile walking path around campus, play ping-pong or volleyball, or stop in our 24- hour fitness center for a group or individual workout) to community service and many employee resource groups including Pride!, Women’s Leadership Network and a Young Professionals Network.

position: Mentor and teach chess to underserved children online
description:
Full Job Description

Y STEM and Chess Inc. (YSC) mission is to empower underserved and at-risk children with an opportunity to pursue STEM careers and change their life trajectory. We teach underserved children remotely in chess, math, and computer science to empower them to pursue STEM majors/professions with the support of professionals. This is a volunteer position

Our first focus is on our society’s unfulfilled need for students with a firm learning foundation to pursue a life in the world of STEM. The second and primary focus of YSC is fulfilling those needs, by working with the children of our socially and economically underserved populations. We introduce and engage these in the world of STEM through our curriculum. The goal is to provide students from this group the skills, knowledge, and opportunity to enter STEM career paths, assist in solving the critical shortage of STEM-skilled citizens, and helping their families escape poverty.

We work with schools with a large percentage of students qualifying for free or reduced-cost lunch programs. Students of this group are often rebellious, not because they are unable to learn but they respond to different learning approaches. We want our mentors to become friends, role models, and confidants to establish a sense of belonging with our students in the STEM community.

We are looking for vibrant individuals that have an animated passion for STEM and want to share that joy with children from underserved backgrounds that are desperate for positive mentors.

You will be tutoring in chess, along with mentoring to start. Individuals that are interested in working with kids should have knowledge of at least one of these concepts, clean background, patience, and willingness to work with these types of children. We will help those interested in learning our method. Our mentors will need to be available to volunteer for 1 hour to five hours a week completely remote.

description:
Full Job Description

This role is responsible for developing speech synthesis systems that not only generate high-quality speech but also are supportive to different generation conditions. As a research engineer at XL8 your responsibilities will include:

  • Research and develop state-of-the-art Deep Learning (DL) and Speech Synthesis algorithms on various scenarios, such as single/multi speaker models, speech style transfer, semi-supervised speech synthesis, speech generation conditioned on speaking prosody/style/noise level, etc.
  • Analyze and identify the strengths/weaknesses of our speech synthesis engines and improve them iteratively
  • Develop DL model training/testing codebase and related tools
  • Collaborate with software engineers for model deployments and addressing customer feedback

Minimum Qualifications

  • Fluency in Korean.
  • Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
  • 2 years of work experience in Machine Learning or AI.
  • Programming experience in Python and C++.

Preferred Qualifications

  • PhD in NLP/Machine Learning or equivalent experience.
  • Experience with Deep Learning frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.).
  • Experience in Speech Processing and Speech Synthesis.
  • Experience in improving Machine Learning models and algorithms in real-world products.
  • Experience in publishing papers at leading AI conferences (ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, etc.)

Send an email with a resume to recruit at xl8.ai to apply!

Be Part of Building the Future

Dremio is the data lake engine company. Our mission is to reshape the world of analytics to deliver on the promise of data with a fundamentally new architecture, purpose-built for the exploding trend towards cloud data lake storage. Dremio eliminates the need for the complex and expensive workarounds that have been in use for decades, such as data warehouses (whether on-premises or cloud-native), structural data prep, ETL, cubes and extracts. We do this by enabling lightning-fast queries directly against data lake storage, combined with full self-service for data users and full governance and control for IT. The results for enterprises are extremely compelling: 100X faster time to insight; 10X greater efficiency; zero data copies; and game-changing simplicity. And equally compelling is the market opportunity for Dremio—with our newly attained unicorn status, we are well on our way to disrupting a $25BN+ market.

Full Job Description
Company Background

Since 2012, founder James Rogers has been on a mission to tackle the global Food Waste Crisis with a goal of providing a more sustainable, equitable path forward for the global food system. Apeel is an edible protective layer that extends fruits' and vegetables' shelf-life. Apeel-covered fruits and vegetables spoil slower and require less refrigeration, and the plant-derived peel reduces the use of plastic and other products harmful to the planet. Apeel pulls material from the natural skins, peels, seeds, and pulp found on fruits and vegetables, to create the extra protective peel. The thin layer slows down water loss and oxidation, which can help keep those fruits and vegetables from browning and spoiling.

Company Culture

At Apeel Sciences, we look to nature to help the global food system improve quality, reduce waste, and ensure an abundant future for our planet. Apeel is comprised of highly talented, deeply passionate, and tight-knit team members who are excited by the opportunity to challenge the status quo, obsessed with solving problems, and truly seek to positively change how we feed the world.

Our people are fundamental to our company's success and continued growth. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

About This Role

The Data Science team is responsible for cleaning, organizing, and analyzing supply chain data to glean meaningful insights and opportunities, as well as building predictive models to automate and streamline business decision-making. We are seeking a motivated Data Science Intern who will analyze hyperspectral image data of fresh produce and test various machine learning approaches to perform non-destructive quality control and analysis. The program dates for summer 2021 are from June 14th - August 20th (10 weeks). To qualify for this program applicants must be currently enrolled in an accredited US college or university and have at least one semester remaining following the internship program. Additionally during the program dates interns must reside in a state where Apeel is registered to do business: Arizona, California, Colorado, Florida, Iowa, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Michigan, Minnesota, North Carolina, New Jersey, New York, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Washington or Wisconsin.

What You'll Do

Build data pipelines to consolidate and clean data
Exploratory analysis of hyperspectral image data
Implement and deploy machine learning models tailored to hyperspectral image data
Share results and updates in written and presentation format
Collaborate and work with data scientists and other domain experts

What You Bring

Are currently pursuing a PhD (preferred) or MS in Physics, Math, Chemistry, Biology, Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or other scientific discipline
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Technical expertise in Data Science and machine learning with Python

Apeel believes that the scale of our impact is determined by the teams that work with us. As such, we seek to build high-performing teams of people from various experiences and backgrounds who can collectively push our company into new realms. We seek a diverse pool of applicants and consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, citizenship, disability, Veteran status, marital status, or any other protected status. If you have a special need or disability that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Please note that Apeel Sciences does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the event of a recruiter or agency submitting a resume or candidate without a signed agreement being in place, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire such candidates without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted directly to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Apeel Sciences.

Full Job Description
Impossible Foods is addressing the most catastrophic threats facing humanity: climate change and biodiversity collapse. A global transition to a plant-based food system will turn back the clock on atmospheric CO2 levels, restore natural ecosystems and reverse meltdown in wildlife biomass.

The easiest - if not only - way to make our civilization sustainable is to eliminate livestock, the most dangerous technology on Earth. But humans won’t give up meat. So we need to make meat better - more delicious and more nutritious, without animals as the underlying production technology. That means that making meat sustainably is the most important and urgent problem for the global scientific community.

Impossible Foods' mission is to completely replace the use of animals as a food-production technology by offering consumers everything they currently value about animal products - and making products that are vastly superior to their animal analogues.

To do this, we are taking a revolutionary scientific and market-based approach. We are inventing efficient, sustainable ways to transform ingredients from plants into meat, fish and dairy foods that deliver all the pleasures and nutritional benefits consumers demand, without the destructive environmental or public health impact.

Our world-class R&D team has been building the know-how and technology platform to produce meat, fish and dairy foods from plants. Impossible Foods is experiencing rapid growth and is resolutely committed to leading all aspects of the plant-based food revolution—from discovery to commercial production. The only thing that will separate Impossible Foods from success and failure is our ability to recruit more world-class experts.

Want to join? Check out the job opening and requirements below:

We are excited to be kicking off our 2021 Summer Internship Program!

The program will be for 10 weeks starting from June 21st-September 3rd, 2021.

Grow into Junior Business Analyst role via mentoring and hands-on training provided by experienced team

Full Job Description
About Us

Blue River Technology serves the agricultural industry by designing and building advanced farm machines that utilize computer vision and machine learning to enable farmers to understand and manage every plant. These machines help farmers to improve profitability, protects the environment by reducing pesticide use, and captures valuable plant-by-plant data. Blue River is a pioneer in the agricultural robotics space and has developed the See & Spray precision sprayer, which applies pesticide only where needed, and can reduce pesticide use 90%.

John Deere & Company, with over 180 years of experience in designing, manufacturing, and distributing innovative products to farmers, acquired Blue River Technology in the fall of 2017 as an independently run subsidiary. In partnership with John Deere, Blue River has expanded rapidly and together both companies see many opportunities to apply advanced computer vision, machine learning, and robotics technologies to other areas in agriculture beyond spraying.

Our office is located in Sunnyvale, CA and is home to 100+ team members with diverse experience including computer vision, machine learning, systems software, autonomous vehicles and precision agriculture. Our working environment is fast paced and highly collaborative, and employees are excited to use their talents to improve food production and protect the environment.

Summary and Responsibilities

We are looking for a highly skilled engineer/scientist at the cutting edge of control systems and machine learning to push the boundaries of application onto big robots. You will be joining a world-class research and engineering team to provide critical skills in improving existing systems from fundamental understanding to implementation on robot. The role will include work in the following areas:

Work on developing the fundamentals of learning based control applied to hardware (i.e. big robots).
Bring a breadth of classical and modern controls knowledge and systems thinking.
Benchmark existing model based and model free control approaches and participate in improving existing methods.
Requirements
Enrollment in or completion of degree program in Computer Science or related fields
Experience working with machine learning systems, with particular emphasis on reinforcement learning
Attention to detail and ability to work independently
A positive attitude and willingness to take on a variety of tasks as necessary

In addition, the following are a plus:
Enrollment in or completion of advanced degree, e.g., M.S., Ph.D.
Strong applied skills in Python, C++, Hardware, Linux, Modern Controls, Classical Controls & Math
Up to date on current research papers and modern controls methods

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. About Syngenta
Syngenta is a leading agriculture company helping to improve global food security by enabling millions of farmers to make better use of available resources. Through world class science and innovative crop solutions, our 28,000 people in over 90 countries are working to transform how crops are grown. We are committed to rescuing land from degradation, enhancing biodiversity and revitalizing rural communities.

About this Job:
We believe that that most IT departments witness change, we aim to cause it by discovering and applying new and novel technologies to real world problems. We are looking for curious, determined and high performing individuals who will push hard for breakthroughs that help the company.

As an Intern within the Data Platform team, you will work with a global team to enhance the organizations Data Science capabilities in the AWS Cloud. You will work on a project that will deliver the capability to implement and deploy a secured on-demand Data Science platform using SageMaker, Redshift and associated tools. In addition, the capability will deliver the foundation of our Data Pipelines for servicing the needs of the Data Science community.

At the end of the Internship, the goal is:
To be able to deploy workloads on SageMaker in a secure fashion
To be able to prepare the data from our Data Lakes for ingestion into the SageMaker environment
To design a prototype Amazon SageMaker Pipeline
To ensure the integration of required security measures, like the use of KMS, AWS Secrets Manager and other tools to securely manage the data being used and generated
To Develop the metrics required to measure the effectiveness of the platform (availability, cycle time to deploy, errors)
To Deliver a Training Module that lays out the processes for using these toolsets

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Work with the Cloud/Compute, Information Security and Data Science architects to design the environment to meet the requirements
Build test cases and implement security controls needed to ensure end-to-end security of the environment

May 2021– August 2021

Qualifications

Education & Experience:
Currently pursuing a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field with a graduation date on or after Dec 2021
Strong programming experience with Python or Java, SQL, MEAN stack, HTML5, CSS. Front end development experience using AngularJS or REACT is a plus
Understanding and familiarity with AWS Data Science tools (RedShift, SageMaker, etc.)
Should be knowledgeable about the AWS ecosystem and services

Additional Knowledge, Skills, Traits & Abilities:
A self-starter who is motivated to take ownership of projects and drive task to completion
Passionate about improving users’ experience
Curious about and keeps up to date with current technology industry and developments
Excellent verbal and written communication skills including strong interpersonal skills

Highly energetic, committed, and self-driven

Full Job Description
About Pivot Bio:
Fueled by an innovative drive and a deep understanding of the soil microbiome, Pivot Bio is pioneering game-changing advances in agriculture. Our first commercial product harnesses the power of naturally-occurring microbes to provide nutrients to crops. We are dedicated to providing new sustainable ways for farmers to improve yield as they work to help feed the world's growing population. Read/Hear more about Pivot Bio on OneZero or CNN.

Position: Geospatial Data Science Intern, Berkeley CA Headquarters or Remote, May 2021

A crucial step in Pivot's goal to reduce agricultural dependence on synthetic nitrogen fertilizer is to characterize the performance and sustainability impacts of our products in the field. As part of the Field Technology team you will help bring together advanced analytical tools with sensor and other geospatial data to answer questions relevant to product development, experimental design, and outreach to growers. The internship will involve development of tools to aid analysis of geospatial data, possibly including algorithms for cleaning data and characterizing spatial dependency as well as modeling environmental relationships with product performance, and visualizing results.

Responsibilities:
Develop and productionize geospatial models and visualization tools to improve characterization of product field performance using a combination of remote sensing and field sample data.
Build and curate a repository of geospatial data layers to support field characterization at multiple scales.
Support statistical consultation with agronomy and laboratory teams for designing and analyzing experimental data.

Qualifications and Experience

Masters or pursuing PhD in a quantitative discipline, such as engineering, ecology, or computer science. Degrees with an emphasis in agricultural or other environmental sciences preferred.
Experience building statistical models for geospatial data or other types of large highly-autocorrelated datasets.
Demonstrated ability to build organized, reproducible analytical workflows in an open-source programming language such as Python (preferred) or R.
Experience with open-source geoprocessing and visualization tools such as QGIS or python geospatial libraries
Experience with Bayesian probabilistic programming tools (Stan, pymc3) or process-based crop/soil models a plus
Strong communication and organizational skills

Must be authorized to work in the United States

What we offer:
Exciting opportunity contribute to and work with a talented and fun team
Opportunity to gain real-world, practical experience in your field of interest

About the role

As member of ML-Tech Algorithms tam, the candidate (1) Analyze complex and advanced NN and to support architecture development (2) Conduct exploration to develop optimized models to support architecture development (3) Develop algorithms including deployment and network optimization to enable running of industry NN on ARM IP.

What will I be accountable for?

Accountabilities include developing new algorithms that can make state-of-the-art deep networks more suitable for resource-constrained Arm hardware , e.g., Arm CPUs/GPUs/NPUs (Neural Processing Units are specialized hardware used for fast processing of Deep Neural Networks)) and Neural Architecture Search where the idea is to find an architecture for deep networks that achieves high accuracy despite incurring low computational costs.

Complex mathematics/statistics for research and development of effective, new algorithms

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program:
The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
1. Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
2. Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
3. Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
SAP DSC Emerging Technologies and Innovation Team is a strategic innovation entity within SAP Intelligent Spend & Business Network combining software engineering excellence with thought leadership and entrepreneurial spirit. We focus on building pioneer game-changing solutions while in close collaboration with customers and partners in industry and research as well as with other SAP units. By exploring unconventional ideas and developing inspiring proofs of concept, we push the state of the art in computer science and enterprise application fields in order to provide SAP foresight into future trends. You will become part of this exciting international team that works in the heart of Silicon Valley. We are looking for new team members with an innovative mindset to build the next generation of supply chain solutions.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP Concur iXp Intern- Product Analyst
Location: Virtual
Expected start date to end date: June 2021 -August 2021

In this role, you’ll:
  • Work closely with the team to understand requirements and convert to new software programs including developing, testing and implementing.
  • Have the unique opportunity to design, develop and deliver features as part of Business Network teams.
  • Collaborate and innovate with other engineering teams to deliver state-of-the-art SaaS application.
  • Work with team members to conduct root cause analysis
  • You will also be working in an Agile SCRUM environment with development responsibilities that span across the whole stack of the development.
Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful, innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

  • Master’s or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Science
  • Knowledge of Product Management
  • Knowledge of SQL and No SQL databases
  • Knowledge of Cloud technologies
  • Good coding skills and knowledge around using scientific, distributed programming and scripting languages like R, Python, Pyspark and/or Java.
  • Good foundation in statistics and machine learning algorithms
  • Knowledge on how to build prototypes and be able to understand the existing code base.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills on both technical and non-technical topics.
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities.
