Full Job Description
Company Background

Since 2012, founder James Rogers has been on a mission to tackle the global Food Waste Crisis with a goal of providing a more sustainable, equitable path forward for the global food system. Apeel is an edible protective layer that extends fruits' and vegetables' shelf-life. Apeel-covered fruits and vegetables spoil slower and require less refrigeration, and the plant-derived peel reduces the use of plastic and other products harmful to the planet. Apeel pulls material from the natural skins, peels, seeds, and pulp found on fruits and vegetables, to create the extra protective peel. The thin layer slows down water loss and oxidation, which can help keep those fruits and vegetables from browning and spoiling.

Company Culture

At Apeel Sciences, we look to nature to help the global food system improve quality, reduce waste, and ensure an abundant future for our planet. Apeel is comprised of highly talented, deeply passionate, and tight-knit team members who are excited by the opportunity to challenge the status quo, obsessed with solving problems, and truly seek to positively change how we feed the world.

Our people are fundamental to our company's success and continued growth. If you are ready for an opportunity to jump in, take ownership, and drive meaningful outcomes in a highly collaborative, communicative, and dynamic environment, we would love to connect with you!

About This Role

The Biological Sciences team is responsible for facilitating and furthering Apeel's understanding of the produce we work with (and the pathogens that live on that produce) through the use of molecular, cellular and microbiology techniques. We are seeking a motivated Biological Sciences Intern who will support the bioinformatics and data science initiatives of the team through the analysis of provided data sets and the development of new analysis pipelines. The program dates for summer 2021 are from June 14th - August 20th (10 weeks). To qualify for this program applicants must be currently enrolled in an accredited US college or university and have at least one semester remaining following the internship program. Additionally during the program dates interns must reside in a state where Apeel is registered to do business: Arizona, California, Colorado, Florida, Iowa, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Michigan, Minnesota, North Carolina, New Jersey, New York, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Washington or Wisconsin.

What You'll Do

Work with large Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) datasets to investigate patterns of differential gene expression
Use, extend, and where applicable, develop new pipelines for expression data analysis
Identify and/or develop workflows for data mining of large datasets
Collaborate with other scientists to leverage the findings from your analysis to inform the design of future experiments
Interpret outputs of metagenomics workflows for biological insight and relevance
Evaluate microbial functional diversity in metagenome samples
Develop tools and pipelines for characterizing genomes and metagenomes by identifying genes and biological pathways of interest

What You Bring

Are currently pursuing an AA, AS, BA or BS degree in a combination of relevant Computer Science and Biological Science fields (Computational Biology, Biostatistics, Bioinformatics, Computer Science or related disciplines) is highly desired
Proficiency scripting in R, Python, Unix/Bash, or Perl
Experience with relational databases, e.g. SQLite, a plus
Familiarity with open-source bioinformatics tools and algorithms
Understanding of molecular biology/microbiology concepts and next generation sequencing
Initiative to learn and build new pipelines/tools
Ability to grasp new concepts quickly and ask clarifying questions
Strong analytical skills. Demonstrate attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communicator, able to collaborate with molecular biologists and microbiologists
Self-motivated with a creative, systematic, problem-solving approach to projects

Apeel believes that the scale of our impact is determined by the teams that work with us. As such, we seek to build high-performing teams of people from various experiences and backgrounds who can collectively push our company into new realms. We seek a diverse pool of applicants and consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, citizenship, disability, Veteran status, marital status, or any other protected status. If you have a special need or disability that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Please note that Apeel Sciences does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the event of a recruiter or agency submitting a resume or candidate without a signed agreement being in place, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire such candidates without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted directly to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Apeel Sciences.

Full Job Description
Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

Thus, through our enriching co-op program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists.

Co-ops alternate between school and full-time work assignments each semester. You will test our industry-leading simulation software while gaining real experience in your field of study. Each semester builds upon the foundational learning that prepares you for more advanced problem solutions. You will support one of our business units, including but not limited to the following:

Design Business Unit
Platform Development Unit
Licensing & Install Unit
Mechanical Business Unit
Release Management Unit

This co-op is a 40-hour per week paid position starting May 2021 and concluding August 2021. This position is Remote.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Work along-side the department's testing team to conduct interactive and batch tests.
Write scripts to run testing responsibilities via unit or automated tests.
Analyze results, log and retest and bugs found.
Improve the efficiency and accuracy of Ansys products.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Summer 2021 semester rotation for Engineers.
Pursuing a BS in Mechanical Engineering, Software Engineering or related technical degree with a GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to university after the completion of the co-op program.
Exposure to CAD and/or FEA.
Exposure to Unix/Windows/Linux systems.
Sharp and tenacious problem-solving skills.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Exposure to programming using C++, C#, Java or Python is a plus.
Experience with Ansys Workbench.
Pursuing a minor in Computer Science with a Mechanical Engineering major.

CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs - guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:

Customer focus
Results and Accountability
Innovation
Transparency and Integrity
Mastery
Inclusiveness
Sense of urgency
Collaboration and Teamwork

WORKING AT ANSYS
At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished". It's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.
Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 18 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

You are a motivated student pursuing a degree in computer science and are passionate about custom application development. You are driven, logical, and innovative and thrive in a fast-paced environment where you can create custom applications from scratch.

Full Job Description
Org Marketing Statement

With annual sales of $14.3 billion in fiscal year 2019, Parker Hannifin is the world's leading diversified manufacturer of motion and control technologies and systems, providing precision-engineered solutions for a wide variety of mobile, industrial and aerospace markets. The company has operations in 50 countries around the world. Parker has increased its annual dividends paid to shareholders for 63 consecutive fiscal years, among the top five longest-running dividend-increase records in the S&P 500 index.

Position Summary

We have two internship openings. As a member of the Internet of Things (IoT) team, the Software Engineering Intern will work with the IoT software engineering team and data analytics solution architects to collect data from products, develop algorithms to analyze time series data from these products, deploy those solutions to the edge and cloud to enable customers to take action to reduce downtime, improve performance and understand the status of their equipment. As a software engineer, the candidate will apply software development principles, agile methodology and data analytics to put information in a way that customers can understand. The responsibilities include development of user interfaces, data access APIs to interface between Parker components on machines to the cloud databases and test automation using up to date tools and technology in an edge and cloud environment.

Responsibilities

  • Develop software for the IoT Azure based web portal - Develop software for the gateway that aggregates signal data and sends to Azure Cloud - Comply to engineering standards with the guidance of senior engineers - Interpret time series data from machines and components to enable customers to reduce downtime, optimize performance and utilization, and to streamline maintenance - Collaborate with product teams to identify key data sources and required sensing, acquisition and compute strategies to deploy those models into real-time edge systems or to the cloud - Develop, code, and deploy algorithms to interpret IoT data—either using big data tools for historical reporting or through time series machine learning for condition monitoring - Implement solutions that combine data from multiple sources into easy to understand alerts, reports and metrics - Able to integrate data to predict and prevent failures - Understand machine control data, interpret sensor data and build optimal control solutions
Qualifications

  • Student pursuing a computer science, computer engineering, data analytics or equivalent bachelor’s degree - Experience in one or more programming languages: Java, Javascript, C++, Python - Strong communication and team work skills - Experience using Jira a plus - Experience working in Azure or similar environment a plus - Experience in predictive modeling a plus - Experience or projects in AI, machine learning or deep learning a plus - Experience or projects in big data tools, such as Spark or Hadoop, a plus - Up to date technical knowledge of data science, including but not limited to: Data provisioning, cleaning, and normalization, large-scale data storage and retrieval, applied statistics a plus - Visualization techniques and tools, such as Power BI, to produce reports, dashboards, metrics, trend data - Positive attitude with passion for growth, can-do approach to obstacles - Able to work flexible hours, working with global development and deployment teams - Able to work in a flexible environment both remote and on site in Elk Grove Village as conditions require

Full Job Description

2021 Tech Start-Up Fellowship

SCLA Summary

TXT: Teens Exploring Technology is an award winning, nationally recognized technology-based start‐up non-profit organization that focuses on inspiring underserved boys, grades 9th-11th to become confident leaders using technology as a tool to improve marginalized communities. Our focus is to develop young men of color into tech leaders through skills in leadership, entrepreneurship, UX design and code. During the summer, we partner with the University of Southern California (USC) to immerse the youth into our lean start-up Summer Coding Leadership Academy (SCLA). Teens develop a tech business that focuses on solving a social problem in underrepresented communities during SCLA. The White House, City of Los Angeles, Google, Mashable, Re/code, and Inc. Magazine have recognized TXT as an innovative organization.

Tech StartUp Fellowship

The Fellows are a vital element to the success of our Summer Coding Leadership Academy. As a fellow you will become a tech entrepreneur and help inspire the next generation of Black and Latino tech entrepreneurs. You will coach teens in solving critical social issues while developing a tech solution. You will have the opportunity to manage a teen tech‐start up and help your team pitch to investors, for a grand prize of $4000. All fellows will have the opportunity to learn from top entrepreneurs, investors, and tech mentors. Our fellows will be mentored by professionals from Google, Tinder, Snapchat, and other tech companies . We are looking for self-motivated individuals who are willing to learn in a fast-paced environment. Bottom line, we need hustlers, quick learners with the eagerness to change the world. Fellows must have a passion for mentoring high school students and positively impacting their lives.

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Identify, plan, and achieve youth development goals for a team of 4 youth
  • Motivate TXT participants by building an innovative tech community
  • Manage team project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables with your technical expertise
  • Connect and build relationships with gurus from top tech startups
  • Work in multiple teams and take on tasks as needed
  • Respond effectively to the daily problems that arise, often with creative solutions

Fellows will receive training in the following topics:

  • Lean Startup Environment
  • Effectively manage numerous projects while simultaneously meeting aggressive deadlines in a dynamic environment
  • Architect, design, develop and support a highly scalable mobile app application
  • Lead a diverse team from incubation to full-scale product development
  • Network with key hiring managers at tech companies
  • Understand fundamentals of launching a startup, including raising money
  • Apply design thinking in order to develop products that will disrupt low income communities

Minimum Qualifications

  • Undergraduate student at a 4-year university majoring in computer science, business, social sciences, or similar fields
  • No experience is required, but the ability to learn fast is a must

Desired Qualifications

  • Excellent organization skills and a self-starter
  • Interest in coding, innovation and development with technology
  • Demonstrated ability to work well in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent communication skills and high emotional intelligence
  • Willingness to inspire Black and Latino boys to change the world of injustice

Timeframe

Fellows must be available to attend a mandatory orientation in March 2021. Exact date will be determined at a later time. Fellows must attend monthly Saturday 2-hour training sessions from March – May. In addition, Fellows will participate in a weeklong retreat from June 14-18, 2021. Core programming will take place from June 14th, 2021 – August 13th, 2021

Full Job Description

EuroTube is a professional team of engineers, scientists and mission operatives who build Europe’s first test infrastructure for vacuum transportation that can operate vehicles efficiently in the target speed regime of 700 to 900 km/h – a minimal requirement for vactrain concepts. Accommodating the interest of universities and engineering companies who need test facilities to develop the technology in a sustainable way, EuroTube provides a non-profit testing platform with a 3km-long, -scaled and accessible vacuum tube in Switzerland. Hence EuroTube is growing an interdisciplinary team that is responsible for the design, engineering and construction of key elements of this infrastructure.

Responsibilities

  • Design high capacity point-to-point (PTP) wireless backhaul using Tier 1 radio equipment across a variety of frequency bands and technologies.
  • Conduct surveys and site walks to validate radio and IoT network design and generate a detailed statement of work (SOW) for installation of both on-Tube radio and sensory equipment and in-Tube structured sensing, cabling and distribution, switching, power, and grounding.
  • Work with industry partners to research and implement upcoming radio and IoT architectures
  • Write and execute verification test plans, test procedures, and test reports against product requirements and relate to overall system performance.
  • Create electrical schematics or drawings for communication systems as needed for both the Tube and Track-Vehicle equipment.
  • Design and troubleshoot RF test setups for various RF environments and associated support equipment to support execution of testing strategies
  • Participate in development of new RF designs and drive optimisation for performance, manufacturability and cost.
  • Create electromagnetic simulation models of hardware (antennas, filters, PCB layout) as needed to design and evaluate performance.
  • Test and measurement of RF coexistence with other electrical systems such as high power systems, electric motors, etc..
  • Drive RF electrical architecture, specification, component selection, circuit board design, implementation, verification, board bring up and debugging.
  • Partner with software, mechanical, thermal, manufacturing, production and test teams to drive full product cycle to close.

Basic Qualifications

  • Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related engineering technical or physics field, or equivalent work experience
  • 5+ years of experience with electromagnetic theory and/or RF communication systems
  • 5+ years of experience with Matlab, LabVIEW, Python, SPICE, SQL, and/or National Instruments hardware

Preferred Skills and Experience

  • Advanced degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering.
  • 5+ years of electronic product experience designing hardware from concept through production; strong emphasis on full life cycle development of new hardware products and not small incremental updates to legacy hardware.
  • 5+ years of professional experience design, testing, troubleshooting and debugging RF telecommunication systems.
  • 5+ years in wireless system design (PMP, PTP, mobile) and Radio access network (RAN) planning, preferably in deploying greenfield networks.
  • Solid and deep experience with wireless technologies including photonic techniques, optical switching, 5G, MIMO, WiFi-6, LTE, WiMAX, HSPA+, UMTS, EVDO, GSM, CDMA, TDMA and GPRS.
  • Design, deployment and optimisation experience acquired in design-build projects with a wireless provider, consultancy, or radio equipment supplier.
  • Experience designing systems to compliance under various European Telecommunications Standards Institute (ETSI) rules and regulations.
  • Experience with RF planning tools (Siradel, Atoll, Planet, or IBwave) and GIS tools (MapInfo or ArcView).
  • Experience with Digital Mobile Radio (DMR) protocols and Tiers as related to ETSI communication standards.
  • Wide range of experience in RF system simulation and analysis using Ansys HFSS, CST, Microwave Office, Keysight ADS, and/or Sonnet.
  • Experience in link budget analysis, chain analysis, EVM analysis, and throughput analysis.
  • Experience with environmental testing, or unit level testing (significant academic projects, internships, and traditional professional experience all qualify).
  • Some understanding of computers and programming languages (Python, C/C++).
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a highly cross-functional role.
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, autonomously driven, and demanding start-up atmosphere.
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Passion for advancing the vacuum transport industry.

Additional Requirements

  • Some travel in Central Europe may be required.
  • English, French and/or German language and communication proficiency to engage with telecommunications authorities such as ETSI / BAKOM.

Cyber Engineer Intern

Raytheon Intelligence & Space (RIS) has a Cyber Engineer Internship opportunity for current college students to join and expand our Cyber Engineering Team located in Indianapolis, Indiana. As a Cyber Engineering Intern, you will work with a team of talented and experienced engineers in performing many core activities to include providing certified services and support for Information Assurance/Program Protection efforts for compliance with governing DoD Cybersecurity directives.

Our nationwide college-recruiting program, offers students from a variety of colleges and universities assignments that help you realize your career goals. Work with the best! From a world-class customer profile, to the work being done at the ends of earth, Raytheon offers a wealth of opportunities for your future and beyond. This internship opportunity is for the summer of 2021, ranges in length from 10-12 weeks and may include mentoring, special projects, and end of assignment presentations. Work with other interns and learn from our team of experts.

Key responsibilities for the qualified candidate include:
  • Provide basic support preparing IA Assessment and Authorization documentation (RMF) and participating in program level risk assessments during the A&A processes
  • Provide basic support assessing system vulnerabilities, applying system hardening and verifying compliance with applicable Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs)
  • Provide basic support for implementing embedded Cybersecurity Solutions, Security Authorization requirements, vulnerability assessments, threat mitigation, and emerging Cybersecurity technologies
Security Clearance & Other Requirements:
This position requires the ability to access systems that contain information restricted to US Citizens based on certain Federal Government contractual requirements.

For Multi-Level Intern Requisitions:
  • This position can be a Salary Grade of G04, G05 or NUG based on the candidate's qualifications as they relate to the skills, experience and responsibility requirements for the position.
  • G04 (College Junior by Fall 2021) - must have completed 60 hours of college
  • G05 (College Senior by Fall 2021) - must have completed 90 hours of college
  • NUG (Post- Graduate-Masters-PhD by Fall 2021) - must have an undergraduate degree and currently enrolled or about to enroll in a graduate degree program
Requirements:
  • Positive attitude, strong leadership and communication skills
  • Customer focus and collaboration skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Systems, Electrical, Software engineering or Computer Science course work
Desired Requirements:
  • IAT level 2 or greater cybersecurity certification per DoD 8570.01; such as: Security+, CySA+, etc.
  • Exposure to Information Systems Security/Information Assurance, Security Engineering concepts and practices
  • Knowledge of operating systems security features and settings (e.g. Windows, UNIX and Linux)
  • Engineering projects or previous internship experience
A cumulative GPA of 3.0+ is strongly desired.

Required Education:
Currently pursuing a Bachelors degree from an accredited university and entering as a college Junior or Senior OR pursuing a Masters / PhD by Fall 2021. Must be working towards a degree in Engineering (Computer Engineering, Electrical, Software or Systems), Computer Science or a closely related STEM field.

Full Job Description
Summary of Role:
This position is for summer 2021 Engineering Intern within GLOBALFOUNDRIES Technology Enablement Department located in Malta, NY.
We are looking a highly skilled and motivated Engineering Intern to work on the development of advanced technology nodes, FinFET, FD-SOI and Bulk nodes, within a dynamic team of semiconductor development experts. This position involves activities associated with the defining and implementing Schematic level Electrical Rule checks. These rules will help designers to avoid any design errors; un-intended connectivity resulting in sub optimal or catastrophic chip failures. Once standardized checks are defined these rules need to be implemented in industry standard EDA tool. Selected candidate will work closely with FAB Technology Development, internal design teams, Internal PDK (LVS/ERC) teams to understand and validate Design and define, refine the Rules. This should also help in understand and validate design driven fail modes. The goal of the internship is to define technology independent and reusable electrical rule checks. Selected candidate will be working on advanced technology nodes (12nm/22nm/28nm) and must have detailed understanding of MOSFET designs, layout and circuits.

Essential Responsibilities:
Implement Schematic Electrical Rule checks(ERC) in PERC or SVRF or any industry standard EDA tool
Currently ERC is coded as layout check, this is an opportunity to port these checks to schematic level and add more appropriate checks and enhance the checking methodology.
Define and standardize ERC across advanced node technologies.
Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and program

Required Qualifications:
Education – Graduating Senior or Junior in Electrical Engineering / Computer Science or other related discipline
Experience – N/A.
Travel – (% of travel required) - None Expected.
Language Fluency – English
Physical Capacity Demands – None

Preferred Qualifications:
Undergraduate - in Electrical Engineering or Computer science or Physics.
Basic understanding of Semiconductor Device physics and computer programming,
Familiarity with EDA tools, schematic design, layout and simulations, scripting languages PERL, Tcl, Shell will be added advantages.

Full Job Description
Work for Indiana

Grow your career with the State of Indiana! With more than 50 executive branch agencies, the State of Indiana is a diverse workforce offering employees stimulating and challenging projects across a broad scope of career opportunities. As a State of Indiana employee, you impact the well-being of Indiana’s communities every day.

At the State of Indiana, we don’t just talk about diversity and inclusion – Our goal is to create a welcoming, accessible, and equitable workplace, with a workforce that is representative of the State of Indiana population. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

About the Indiana Office of Technology (IOT):
IOT provides measurable, secure, consistent, reliable enterprise-technology services at cost-effective prices to our partner agencies so they can better serve our mutual customer, the Hoosier taxpayer.

About the Governor's Public Service Summer Internship Program (GPSSIP):

The Governor’s Public Service Summer Internship Program (GPSSIP) is designed to give college students real-world, hands-on experience in their desired field of study to enhance marketability upon graduation. Participation in the program will offer students a multitude of experiences including networking with state employees, resume building and soft skills workshops, agency head panels, and much more.

This is an unpaid summer-long internship.

About the Internship:
This internship is based in the Deployment Room. As part of the IOT’s seat service offering to its partner agencies, a new PC, under warranty is provided every 4 years. The PC Refresh Team manages and coordinates a 4-year rotating schedule that includes all agencies and their PC replacement dates. The intern provides support for the imaging and deployment of PC Hardware.

A Day in the Life:
The essential functions of this role are as follows:
Responsible for imaging new and used PC hardware;
Responsible for updating job orders and checking out PC hardware to IOT techs;
Processes PC returns by scanning and updating PC inventory records;
Updates inventory counts for PC accessories in the Deployment Room;
Packages and sends PC hardware via couriers to Agency Sites throughout the State;
Customer service is also a crucial element for this position.

The job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time.

What We're Looking For:
The ideal candidate for this internship has an Associate's or Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

What You'll Need for Success:
Advanced experience, and advanced knowledge of the following: PC-Desktops and Laptops, peripherals, and client/server technology.
Industry recognized certifications such as A+, Network +, or MCSE are a benefit.
Understanding of Internet technologies beneficial. Hands on experience supporting the MicroSoft Office Suite.
Solid verbal and written communication and documentation skills are required.

Supervisory Responsibilities/Direct Reports:
This role does not provide direct supervision to direct reports.

Equal Employment Opportunity:
The State of Indiana is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Working in a fast-paced IT Application development environment using an agile methodology to analyze, design, develop, and configure software to automate the business intake and Underwriting processes.

Other development opportunities:
Programming using GOSU language (Guidewire - Policy Center Application)
System Analysis and working with a group of highly skilled technical team of developers, testing professionals, project managers, product owners and business / System Analysts.
Understanding the SDLC process, Agile methodology using SCRUM
Understanding Devops – Continuous Integration / Continuous deployment (CI/CD) practices
Learn about the Zurich IT Application landscape and be part of a critical IT Transformation program.

Basic Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in Master’s program in Computer Science and will be enrolled in the fall of 2021
Be legally eligible to work in the U.S

Preferred Qualifications:
Programming
Business / System Analysis
Java, C# or any modern programming language
Algorithms and object-oriented design
Complex data structures (maps, lists, etc.)
Scripting
Understanding of Agile / Devops practices
Web-based applications and technologies
Application servers : Apache Tomcat etc.
Database Servers: Microsoft SQL server
HTML, JavaScript, SQL
Web Services, XML, Messaging
Test-driven development

A future with Zurich

Now is the time to move forward and make a difference. At Zurich, we want you to share your unique perspectives, experiences and ideas so we can grow and drive sustainable change together. As part of a leading global organization, Zurich North America has over 148 years of experience managing risk and supporting resilience. We are a leading provider of commercial property-casualty insurance solutions and a wide range of risk management products and services for businesses and individuals. Today, we serve more than 25 industries, from agriculture to technology and insure 90% of the Fortune 500®. Our growth strategy is not limited to our business. As an employer, Zurich strives to provide ongoing career development opportunities and foster an environment where voices are diverse, behaviors are inclusive, actions drive equity, and our people feel a sense of belonging. Be a part of the next evolution of the insurance industry. Join us in building a brighter future for our people, our customers and the communities we serve. Zurich maintains a comprehensive employee benefits package for employees as well as eligible dependents and competitive compensation. Please click here to learn more.

As a global company, Zurich recognizes the diversity of our workforce as an asset. We recruit talented people from a variety of backgrounds with unique perspectives that are truly welcome here. Taken together, diversity and inclusion bring us closer to our common goal: exceeding our customers’ expectations. Zurich does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other legally protected status. Full Job Description
Description

When you join Daimler, you become an agent of change within our global community of people working to create a cleaner, safer, and more efficient world for today and tomorrow. Through innovation at all levels, our teams ensure our world-changing brands continue to increase the quality of life and the business success of our customers, their customers, and the world around them. The Daimler Trucks North America (DTNA) brand portfolio is second to none, and includes Freightliner Trucks, Western Star Trucks, Detroit engines and components, Thomas Built Buses and Freightliner Custom Chassis.

We are the undisputed leader in the commercial vehicle market and the industry’s technology trendsetter. Empowered by purpose, DTNA employees drive a Technology Revolution through innovative products and a customer-centric culture. Our dedication to our customers and society does not end once our products hit the road. That’s because we believe that business success and social responsibility go hand in hand. We immerse ourselves in our customer’s experience, and support the environmental responsibilities of our sites to ensure our products are the reliable, sustainable and the desired tools of the future.

experience through exciting and real-life learning opportunities. Candidates must work in accordance with corporate core values of passion, respect, integrity and discipline. Full Job Description
About the Company
Arcules is a fast paced startup rethinking the video surveillance market and moving customers to a smarter, more reliable and secure cloud-based solution. As a technology spin out of Canon Inc. our technology brings video and smart building elements together and our analytics help customers make more informed decisions.

Overview of the Job
The Arcules product management team is the champion of the customer and responsible for the end-to-end success of new products and features. They thrive at understanding the customer's needs and working in small teams with engineers and designers to build cutting edge solutions. They are data-driven, skilled communicators, and leaders within the organization driving the company and customer growth.

Arcules is looking for a Product Manager Intern to join our high performance team. As a Product Manager Intern you will provide strategic oversight and drive results for Arcules. You must be available to work a minimum of 2 hours a day, 5 days a week remotely (subject to change based on COVID-19 restrictions) and available to fulfill tasks on an as-needed basis at the Irvine Headquarters.

Responsibilities
Projects might include competitor analysis, market sizing, user research, feature/solution specification, and go-to-market planning
Work closely with cross-functional teams to drive business initiatives forward
In conjunction with Design and Engineering, own, project manage and execute on several projects that span the breadth of the product manager experience
Be the voice of the customer in the fast-paced process consisting of several autonomous engineering teams
Thought leadership and represent the Arcules services in the best light externally
Other duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications
Pursuing an MBA with preference for concentration in Entrepreneurship, Marketing or related field
Undergraduate degree, preference for technical fields such as Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Design or related field
Interest in agile design and development process in a startup environment
Interest in Product Management and the User Experience a plus

Skills/Training Desired
Excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to interact with customers and external partners in a professional manner
Excellent project management skills and ability to manage multiple projects from inception to launch
Self-motivated, driven, goal-oriented, and effective communicator who takes pride in delivering high-quality work
The ability to independently identify, research and resolve issues
Possesses strong attention to detail, curiosity in understanding the why, and a passion to create change
Quantitative and analytical abilities in interpreting data and results
Ability to construct, analyze, and critique market reports and evaluate competition

Full Job Description
Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?

Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 18 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

Who You Are
You are a motivated student passionate about the successful development of the project's initiation, planning, and execution procedures. You excel at continuously adapting in an agile environment with fast delivery times and managing multiple concurrent projects. You are a dependable, persistent, self-disciplined, and goal-oriented individual and thrive in a fast-paced environment where you can ultimately meet and exceed customer satisfaction.
What You'll Do
Clearing obstacles for the team
Establishing an environment where the team can be effective in meeting sprint goals.
Addressing team dynamics
Ensuring a good relationship between the team and product owner as well as others outside the team.
Protecting the team from outside interruptions and distractions
What You'll Need
Working towards a BS in Computer Science or Information Systems or related technical discipline is a plus but if this sounds like something you would be good at – go for it! Your personality, presence, and work ethic are really what we are after.
Familiarity and practice of Agile Development Methodology is a plus
Knowledge of JIRA or any Enterprise Agile tool is a plus
Data & Metrics should excite you
Organized but also flexible
Comfortability speaking up when you have an idea you think should be heard, this includes development team meetings and agile leadership forums

Life at BHG
At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

Why You Should Join BHG
We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified. Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include:

  • 100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
  • Competitive PTO and vacation policies
  • Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year
  • On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff
  • Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities
  • Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses
  • Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program
If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!

Bankers Healthcare Group is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Bankers Healthcare Group is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Full Job Description
Work for Indiana

Grow your career with the State of Indiana! With more than 50 executive branch agencies, the State of Indiana is a diverse workforce offering employees stimulating and challenging projects across a broad scope of career opportunities. As a State of Indiana employee, you impact the well-being of Indiana’s communities every day.

At the State of Indiana, we don’t just talk about diversity and inclusion – Our goal is to create a welcoming, accessible, and equitable workplace, with a workforce that is representative of the State of Indiana population. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

About the Indiana Office of Technology (IOT):
IOT provides measurable, secure, consistent, reliable enterprise-technology services at cost-effective prices to our partner agencies so they can better serve our mutual customer, the Hoosier taxpayer.

About the Governor's Public Service Summer Internship Program (GPSSIP):

The Governor’s Public Service Summer Internship Program (GPSSIP) is designed to give college students real-world, hands-on experience in their desired field of study to enhance marketability upon graduation. Participation in the program will offer students a multitude of experiences including networking with state employees, resume building and soft skills workshops, agency head panels, and much more.

This is an unpaid summer-long internship.

About the Internship:
The Indiana Office of Technology (IOT) Security Team is seeking one or more associate, undergraduate, or graduate students to support Security Operations initiatives on an unpaid basis. The work will require exceptional skills in communication, time management, project management, and data analysis/research. The selected candidate may be called upon to conduct or support interviews with internal (IOT) and external (other agency) stakeholders and/or produce presentation materials for various audiences. The selected candidate must be successful: working in both independent and team settings; working on deadlines, potentially with several/competing requirements; and providing clear, concise work products for supervisors.

For this position, IOT Security is looking for candidates with a strong interest in information and data security, including those not currently enrolled in a technology-focused program. We do encourage applicants who are enrolled in an associate, undergraduate, or graduate program with a focus on information security, information systems, computer science, or risk management (or similar area of study). Since this position may involve access to sensitive, non-classified information, the agency requires that all applicants be willing to live in or near Indianapolis for the duration of the internship.

A Day in the Life:
The essential functions of this role are as follows:
Review and correlate workstation software audit and vulnerability reports.
Review workstation configuration reports.
Document analysis results in presentations, memoranda, white papers, or other designated formats.
Collaborate with Security and Tier 3 staff on workstation vulnerability remediation and configuration management database (CMDB) efforts.
Provide direct assistance to a work coordinator on the development and documentation of a robust process associated with CMDB.
Create informative training material, guidance, and project plans used to support ongoing efforts in vulnerability management and CMDB.
Provide support on customer tickets on an as needed basis.

The job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time.

What You'll Need for Success:
Demonstrate a strong desire to work in information security, risk, and compliance in a public agency.
Have a strong applied knowledge of Microsoft Office 365, with emphasis on analytical tools in Excel.
Have strong analytical and communication skills, demonstrated through professional or academic work.
Have the ability to work independently, generally under guidance and supervision from a supervisor, work coordinator, or other designated colleagues.
Have the ability to work successfully alongside peer colleagues in group settings.
Demonstrate a capacity to collaborate with – and coordinate across - multiple business units.
Manage multiple projects, tasks, and deliverables with exceptional attention to detail.
Exhibit initiative, motivation, and drive to finish deliverables successfully.

Supervisory Responsibilities/Direct Reports:
This role does not provide direct supervision to direct reports.

Equal Employment Opportunity:
The State of Indiana is an Equal Opportunity Employer

As part of our program, you will develop, test and troubleshoot web applications and commercial off-the shelf software (COTS) for the Integrated System Planning team. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is seeking an intern for a dynamic assignment to accelerate customer access to GLOBALFOUNDRIES technologies. This internship will involve documentation, web development, and coordination of functions within GF to ease customer access and use of GF’s technologies. This internship position will offer the candidate a deep view of the state of technology offerings, design flows, and novel cloud-based access and information delivery to serve customer needs. Strong communication and collaboration skills are a must with this internship.

Support the identification and addition of collateral to the emerging EZGF platform and database,

As a Segment Marketing Intern at Micron Technology, Inc., you will assist in inbound and outbound marketing activities in the Embedded market segment.

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/nstemhs
  • Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/nstemhs
  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/nstemhs
  • LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/national-stem-honor-society
  • YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=juHYDfYtB8Q

This unpaid internship can be fulfilled virtually from anywhere around the globe; currently all in-person opportunities are on hold.

Duration Requirements: Whether the internship is for credit or not, National STEM Honor Society (NSTEM) hires interns for a minimum of 240 total hours with no maximum, and a 4 month (15 hour / week) minimum. We have had interns with us now for as long as two years and are still part of the organization.

NSTEM was in the development stage for 3+ years and went live in 2020 with the goal of opening thousands of Chapters across the nation as quickly as possible! Our mission is to inspire innovation and recognize student excellence From K to CareerTM in the fields of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics - inspiring kids as young as kindergarten to get involved and stay involved in STEM hopefully for the rest of their education and careers !

Please visit our website at www.nstem.org to really understand NSTEM and the benefits of starting an NSTEM Chapter. Also, please take a look at the National STEM Honor Society social media platforms on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, and Pinterest!

Management & Leadership Opportunities: There are many opportunities to take on a leadership position in NSTEM to lead small and large teams on a myriad of projects. We have two main roles, Directors and Project Managers (PM's).

  • Directors lead divisions or departments that consist of projects, PM's and team members.
  • Project Managers lead individual projects and teams of interns and take a more defined role into each individual project. In some instances, new interns are promoted directly to Director or PM roles however in most cases, interns are promoted from within to fulfill these leadership roles.

Two Types of Internships: There are two types of internships that NSTEM offers, Accredited and Volunteer Internships:

  • Volunteer Internship: NSTEM offers a "Volunteer Internship" option in addition to our official internship for academic credit. If an individual is interested in interning with NSTEM but is not tied to formal education, the internship will be classified as a "Volunteer Internship." This option is offered for individuals who are not interested in receiving academic credit but rather the experience at NSTEM.
  • Accredited Internship: NSTEM works with colleges and universities to provide an experience that is directly related to desired learning outcomes and will complete all necessary paperwork. NSTEM provides this accredited opportunity by supporting interns in meeting program requirements and agrees to provide written documentation of work performed, recommendations, and evaluations for interns (according to performance standards). In order to offer an internship that complies with federal labor laws, NSTEM adheres to the following conditions:
  • The intern clearly understands that there is no expectation of compensation; this is an unpaid internship opportunity
  • NSTEM internships provide training similar to that given in an educational environment
  • This internship can be tied to intern's formal education programs by the receipt of academic credit
  • NSTEM internships accommodate intern's academic commitments and provide significant educational benefits
  • The duration of this internship provides beneficial learning for a specified amount of time
  • Intern's work complements, rather than displaces, the work of paid employees
  • Internships are conducted without entitlement to a paid job at the conclusion of the internship

Intern Goals & Learning Objectives: An intern working for the National STEM Honor Society can expect to meet their academic and learning goals, career exploration, and industry knowledge led by a committed staff providing an experience to meet them:

  • Increase knowledge of the industry
  • Grow leadership skills and learning to manage large projects
  • Gain experience in adapting to changing roles and environments
  • Conduct research and practice analytical / quantitative skills
  • Assertively engage at work, conduct research effectively, write and present professionally, and make business decisions
  • Understand and implement the roles and responsibilities of Project Managers, which include:
  • Track team members' schedules, tasks, needs, and interests
  • Gain proficiency with tools such as G Suite, Trello, SmartSheets
  • Provide a constant flow of work for team members
  • Establish and use effective communication channels with team members
  • Treat team members with kindness, understanding and respect
  • Organize project materials to achieve outcomes efficiently
  • Learn to ramp up quickly on new projects
  • Lead by example, which means rolling up your sleeves and diving into the project!

Supervision & Mentoring: All interns working for NSTEM will be mentored and supervised by our staff. Directors and Project Managers offer diverse educational backgrounds and expertise within their respective fields. Staff members provide opportunities for interns to work on projects that align with their learning goals with evaluation and constructive feedback along the way. NSTEM believes that successful internships go hand in hand with enjoyable internships. Staff will personally check-in with you throughout your internship experience and make adjustments as necessary in order to ensure that you achieve your internship goals. Our team is constantly available for interns that work in the office as well as those that work virtually. Staff works with the requirements of colleges and universities in order to provide written feedback according to their specific policies. We work tirelessly to ensure all of our interns get the attention they need in pursuant to their internship goals. Interns also have the opportunity to learn from each other as there is much collaboration between both local and remote interns.

Being a part of the National STEM Honor Society expansion is an outstanding opportunity to grow your business, entrepreneurship, film production, social media, marketing, sales, service, and outreach capabilities while contributing to a team with the deep purpose of inspiring more STEM into the lives of our students, educators, sponsors, partners and advisory council members. Interns are given the opportunity to make strategic decisions and practice active learning and reflective thinking. They work in diverse teams with other interns, either in the office or through virtual connections. Because of the cooperative nature of NSTEM's projects, interns are encouraged to form continuing networking relationships with each other. Team building is supported in order to set interns up to thrive in a collaborative environment. After interning at NSTEM,

-------------------------------------------------

The National STEM Honor Society is an educational / business start-up organization that provides interns with interesting, diverse, and stimulating work opportunities unlike most experiences. At NSTEM, you are not limited to just one role, and we encourage you to take advantage of the opportunity to explore a variety of roles, experiences, opportunities, and responsibilities. Supporting your specific interests and individual learning goals, you will engage in focused learning experiences working on projects essential to the day-to-day operation of our organization where you will receive guidance and resources to apply knowledge and skills to your emerging professional lives. Full Job Description
**Note: Unfortunately, Summer Internships at LendingTree are not open to students who will require sponsorship now or at any point in the future. Thank you.

This position will likely work remotely the entire summer. However, our preference is to hire someone who will be based in the Charlotte, NC area on the chance we're able to go back to office during the summer.

THE POSITION

Our former Summer Interns will tell you, LendingTree's Internship Program is selective, challenging and structured to push the limits of what they thought they could do - and they wouldn't have wanted it any other way. Are there easier ways to spend your summer? Absolutely. But a LendingTree Internship will help you grow professionally and also get you closer to landing a phenomenal job once you graduate – maybe even with LendingTree. Here's what you can expect:

Real work. The only person you'll be getting coffee for at LendingTree is yourself. You'll be doing professional level work that will have a real impact on the business
Training. Sure you'll learn a ton of industry skills as you contribute to your team every day, but you'll also go through specific training on: crafting a phenomenal resume and LinkedIn profile, getting interviews and how to handle them, how to give a great presentation and more
You're not alone. In addition from the support from your team you'll be assigned a Mentor outside of your department who will guide you and mentor you throughout the summer
End of summer presentation. At the end of the summer every Intern gives a PPT presentation to Executives which will include a summary of what you accomplished, what you learned and 2 ideas that will either make the company money or save the company money

RESPONSIBILITIES

Own a project – Analyze current customer experiences. Define, and run A/B tests and optimize consumer web-based product to specific metrics.
Monitor and analyze product performance and communicate findings and recommendations for meaningful changes. Define Product requirements for actionable changes and reiterate.
Put together wireframes to support product requirements and changes to be done.
Understand scope of the internal web-based product, participate in workshops. Own feature delivery, and write product requirements by working with business and development teams.
Communicate to partners on the progress of the feature/functionality.

QUALIFICATIONS

Undergrad or grad student (3.5+ GPA required) who will be graduating in Dec. 2021 or May 2022 (GPA must be listed on your resume to be considered).
Preferred majors: Business, Information Technology, Computer Science.
Proficient in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.) and SQL
Good understanding of how APIs work.
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum product development or software development methodologies is preferred.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and GET STUFF DONE.

COMPANY

LendingTree is the nation's largest online lending marketplace. That means we connect customers with multiple lenders so they find the best deals on loans, credit cards, savings accounts and insurance. Our goal is to help people save money, and we believe the best way to do that is by giving them a way to shop for loans and compare lenders so they make their best financial choices. Our CEO Doug Lebda founded the company in 1996 after a frustrating house-hunting experience. In those days, we mostly helped people find good mortgage deals. Now, we help consumers find their best in personal loans, auto loans, business loans, student loans, credit cards, savings accounts, home equity loans and more.

What else you should know:
We're a publicly-traded company (TREE).
We've welcomed several other companies into the LendingTree family to augment our efforts at helping borrowers make their most sensible financial choices.
We've built the LendingTree app and My LendingTree dashboard to give consumers tools to manage and monitor their financial health.
We still make funny commercials.

CULTURE

We're a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial bend. We work hard and test our products often. We're collaborative, ambitious, candid and high-energy. Our teammates are some of the brightest, most talented people you'll ever work with. We care more about your smarts than we do about the kinds of clothes you wear (but please, do wear clothes to work!), and we're pretty good about rewarding innovation, creativity and the knack for just getting stuff done (we even have an award for employees called the GSD, "Get Stuff Done"). Come work with us!

LendingTree is the kind of company that not only promotes diversity and inclusion; we thrive because of these values. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion (or creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or military status.

Dana is a global leader in the supply of highly engineered driveline, sealing, and thermal-management technologies that improve the efficiency and performance of vehicles with both conventional and alternative-energy powertrains. Serving three primary markets – passenger vehicle, commercial truck, and off-highway equipment – Dana provides the world's original-equipment manufacturers and the aftermarket with local product and service support through a network of nearly 100 engineering, manufacturing, and distribution facilities.

Dana Incorporated is seeking to fill four IT Summer Intern positions at the Global Information Technology Center in Maumee, Ohio or Novi, MI. Each intern will be given one or two projects to work on during their internship. These projects will be within Dana’s Corporate Business Analytics, Strategy/EA/PMO, Security and IT Governance departments. At the end of the internship, the intern will deliver presentation to the IT leadership team.

Business Intelligence Analyst Intern The primary focus of this position will be to highlight how data, analysis, and visualizations are used to drive business decisions and strategy. The intern will work in partnership with IT mentors and business stakeholders to implement analytics solutions that support business strategy. The intern may also assist in projects to improve processes within the data analytics team. Students will be assigned to a specific project or enhancement and should be enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program focusing on computer science, information technology, information systems, software engineering, and/or business. Strong analytical skills, exposure to data modeling principles, and experience with any reporting tools is a plus. Intern primary focus will be working on a Microsoft Power BI reporting projects and support. Students applying for this internship will need to have experience with the Microsoft tools.

IT Strategy / Enterprise Architecture I ntern primary focus will be to work in partnership with I.T. Enterprise Architecture (EA) leaders to define opportunities for improving processes and systems, reducing costs, and qualifying potential business benefits of a strategic I.T. approach. The EA intern will be assigned to several projects and should be enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program focusing on computer science, information technology, information systems, engineering, and/or business. Strong analytical skills and self-starter mindset are needed. Exposure to architecture principles, Enterprise architecture governance processes, application portfolio planning are a plus. Experience with SharePoint and Microsoft PowerBI a plus.

Cybersecurity Operations Intern will need to be driven to explore and learn within the I.T. security discipline, seeing how security is an enabler for the business. Students need to have a desire to broaden IT knowledge of security concepts and practices. Students will be assigned a specific project and should be enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program focusing on information technology and information systems.

I.T. Governance Risk & Compliance (GRC) Intern will work directly with the GRC Team to conduct IT risk assessments, analyze and aggregate the risk data, and report findings. The intern should have a desire to broaden IT knowledge of security controls, risk and governance. Students applying for this internship will work with all levels of employees within our I.T. Department enterprise wide. Students will be assigned a specific project and should be enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program focusing on information technology and information systems.

Minimum GPA of 3.0;
Proficient with Microsoft Office software with the ability to learn and build computer proficiency using Microsoft Excel and Word;
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with high degree of accuracy;
Ability to work in a team environment;
Proven problem-solving skills and ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines;
Strong interpersonal skills to work with people at all levels within and outside the organization in a professional manner;
Excellent written and verbal communication and organizational skills;
Uncompromising judgment towards confidentiality and business ethics;
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

Benefits:
Paid Internship/Co-op
Gain valuable work experience
Opportunity for long term growth

About GM

There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Why Work for Us

Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States.

Cadillac Global Marketing has an opening for an Intern, Research & Insights.

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Cadillac has been a leading luxury auto brand since 1902. Today, Cadillac is growing globally with an expanding product portfolio featuring dynamic design and technology. Cadillac's ongoing mission is to return to a preeminent position among global luxury brands, powered by major investments across its business and a renewed passion for excellence.

The position reports to the Cadillac Global Brand Research Lead.

This position will be filled by a Master’s-level student (e.g., MBA, Master in Marketing Research, etc.) currently enrolled in their first year program.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Intern will be responsible for a customer-centered end-to-end project that will bring strategic value to either marketing strategy, a future advertising campaign, or a vehicle launch team. Example projects include calculating the business impact of vehicle launches, measuring performance of new brand campaign, performing early buyer study, personifying segmentation targets, etc. Exposure will to be to a broad base of stakeholders and the intern will potentially need to collaborate across a range of clients, service providers, and team members. Ideal candidate will be naturally curious with the ability to connect dots across disparate data and/or market insight streams. Final deliverable with be presented to the Cadillac Management Team.

Additional Job Description

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS

In progress graduate degree in computer science, analytics, market research, psychology, sociology, anthropology, marketing analytics, business administration or related field
Must have a minimum of a 3.0 overall GPA on a 4.0 scale
Currently enrolled in first year Master's program
Interest and curiosity in using data to influence business outcomes via impactful visualizations and story-lines
Able to work full-time: 40 hours per week during the summer months
Proven analytical problem-solving ability
Demonstrated experience in quant analysis / constructs / paradigms / models
Strong project management skills
Strong teamwork and communication skills and ability to work with all management levels
Ability to collaborate successfully in cross functional and cross-regional teams
Strong presentation skills: ability to communicate complex concepts with compelling, simple and impactful delivery
Natural drive for contributing along with creating new processes and methodologies

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS

Experience with data manipulation (e.g., Excel pivot tables)
Experience with data visualization (e.g., PowerPoint, Tableau)
Understanding of market research methodologies & techniques
Experience with digital insight tools and/or vendors preferred (e.g., Google analytics, Facebook API)
Statistical software skills a plus (e.g., R, SAS, SPSS, STATA, XLSTAT, Excel Stat Pack)
Database management skills a plus (e.g., Access, SQL, Hadoop)

This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States.

Full Job Description
Role description

At Unity, you’ll make a difference. We’re democratizing development, solving hard problems, and enabling the success of our Community in a collaborative, fast-growing environment. You and your desire to make the world a better place will be at the forefront of the real-time revolution, as we create exciting technological advancements in entertainment,film, retail, sales, and other industries – all made possible by the Unity Engine, the most widely used 3D development platform in the world.

We are looking for Backend Software Engineers to join our highly dynamic teams and focus on building and delivering solutions across our Unity engine, monetization suite, and cloud services.

We have Backend SWE opportunities in San Francisco, Bellevue, or Austin, and across multiple organizations including:

Cloud
Ads
R&D (Platform and Graphics)
AI

Responsibilities

Translate business requirements into engineering features and collaborate with teammates to take the features to completion
Design, develop, launch, and maintain code that powers billions of gamers or services across the world
Ensure scalability and reliability of a complex system through effective code design and testing
Operate within a distributed team and work closely with colleagues both local and remote

Requirements

Current student pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent and returning to the degree program after the completion of the internship
Programming experience in a general-purpose programming language (C/C++/C#/Java/Golang/Python)
Experience with one or more of the following: Web Development, Web API’s, Cloud Technologies, and/or SQL or NoSQL databases.
Strong communication skills, both in person and via digital means with the ability to work in a team environment

Bonus Points

A passion for games
Any experience with Unity or other 3d game engines - even if it was only a weekend project
Experience with deploying/managing/launching software to production for real users

About Unity Technologies

Unity is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

The company’s 1,400+ person research and development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than three billion times per month in 2019 on more than two billion unique devices. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.
